en: British, French Foreign Ministers to Re-Invigorate DRC Peace Process - 2002-01-18
kin: Abaminisitiri b’ububanyi n’amahanga b’Ubwongereza, Ubufaransa mu kongera ingufu mu bikorwa by’amahoro bya DRC - 2002-01-18
mt0: British, French Foreign Ministers to Re-Invigorate DRC Peace Process - 2002-01-18

en: The British and French foreign ministers travel to the Democratic Republic of Congo Monday to kickoff a three-day, four-nation tour of the troubled region of Central Africa.
kin: Ku wa mbere, abaminisitiri b’ububanyi n’amahanga b’Ubwongereza n’Ubufaransa berekeje muri Repubulika Iharanira Demokarasi ya Kongo kugira ngo batangire urugendo rw’iminsi itatu, bazenguruka ibihugu bine by'akarere gafite ibibazo muri Afurika yo hagati.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know

en: The mission will be jointly led by British Foreign Secretary Jack Straw and his French counterpart Hubert Vedrine.
kin: Ubu butumwa buzayoborwa n’umunyamabanga w’ububanyi n’amahanga w’Ubwongereza Jack Straw na mugenzi we w’Ubufaransa Hubert Vedrine.
mt0: Return only if you can't translate. If you can't translate simply say you don't know

en: They will be visiting the Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi and Uganda.
kin: Bazasura Repubulika Iharanira Demokarasi ya Kongo, u Rwanda, Uburundi na Uganda.
mt0: They will be visiting the Democratic Republic of Congo, Rwanda, Burundi and Uganda.

en: Their primary objective is to breathe new life into the peace process in the war-torn Congo.
kin: Intego yabo y'ibanze ni uguhumeka umwuka w'ubuzima bushya mu nzira y'amahoro muri Kongo yibasiwe n'intambara.
mt0: Primary objective is to breathe new life into the peace process in the war-torn Congo.

en: Specifically, the British and French want to see the withdrawal of foreign troops who back the Congolese government (n Kinshasa, demobilization of rebels who occupy more than half the country, and peace talks to end the conflict.
kin: By'umwihariko, Abongereza n'Abafaransa bifuza kubona ikurwaho ry'ingabo z'amahanga zishyigikiye guverinoma ya Kongo-Kinshasa, gusezerera mu gisirikare inyeshyamba zigarurira igice cya kabiri cy'igihugu, n'ibiganiro by'amahoro kugira ngo amakimbirane arangire.
mt0: Specifically, the British and French want to see the withdrawal of foreign troops who back the Congolese government (n Kinshasa, demobilization of rebels who occupy more than half of the country, and peace talks to end the conflict.

en: British Foreign Secretary Straw said the mission also has a broader goal of making sure the Congo does not become another Afghanistan.
kin: Umunyamabanga w’ububanyi n’amahanga w’Ubwongereza Straw yavuze ko ubwo butumwa bufite intego nini yo kureba niba Kongo itazaba indi Afuganisitani.
mt0: Leave it alone. If you can't translate simply say you don't know. British Foreign Secretary Straw said the mission also has a broader goal of making sure the Congo does not become another Afghanistan.

en: "The 11th of September has made it much more urgent that we take earlier action against failed, and failing states," he said.
kin: Ati: "Ku ya 11 Nzeri birihutirwa cyane ko dufata ingamba zo kurwanya ibihugu byananiranye, kandi bikinanirana".
mt0: "Umunsi wa 11 Nyakanga ubaye ukomeye cyane ko dufata ibihano byinshi mbere y’uko bishoboka, ndetse n’ibihugu byagiye bifata ibihano byinshi," yagize ati.

en: In Kinshasa, the ministers will meet Congolese President Joseph Kabila. He took power one year ago, after his father, President Laurent Kabila, was assassinated by one of his bodyguards.
kin: I Kinshasa, abaminisitiri bazahura na Perezida wa Kongo, Joseph Kabila. Yafashe ubutegetsi umwaka ushize, nyuma yuko se, Perezida Laurent Kabila, yishwe n'umwe mu bamurindaga.
mt0: In Kinshasa, the ministers will meet Congolese President Joseph Kabila. He took power one year ago, after his father, President Laurent Kabila, was assassinated by one of his bodyguards.

en: Their next stop will be Kigali for talks with Rwandan President Paul Kagame, and the leader of the Rally for Congolese Democracy rebels, Adolphe Onusumba.
kin: Aho niharangira hazakurikiraho Kigali kugira ngo baganire na Perezida w’u Rwanda, Paul Kagame, n’umuyobozi w’inyeshyamba zo muri Repubulika Iharanira Demokarasi ya Kongo, Adolphe Onusumba.
mt0: Next stop will be Kigali for talks with Rwandan President Paul Kagame, and the leader of the Rally for Congolese Democracy rebels, Adolphe Onusumba.

en: The ministers will make a brief visit to Burundi to discuss that country's civil war with President Pierre Buyoya.
kin: Abaminisitiri bazasura u Burundi akanya gato kugira ngo baganire ku ntambara ya gisivili yo muri icyo gihugu na Perezida Pierre Buyoya.
mt0: Minisitiri bose bazafata urugendo rurangiye i Burundi kugira ngo baganira n'umuyobozi wa Repubulika Pierre Buyoya kugira ngo baganira ku ntambara y'igihugu.

en: The tour will end in Uganda, where meetings are scheduled with President Yoweri Museveni and Jean-Pierre Bemba, who leads the Movement for the Liberation of Congo guerrillas.
kin: Uruzinduko ruzarangirira muri Uganda, aho hateganijwe inama na Perezida Yoweri Museveni na Jean-Pierre Bemba uyobora Umuryango uharanira kubohoza inyeshyamba za Kongo.
mt0: Iyi tour izarangiza muri Uganda, aho inama zari iteganyijwe na Perezida Yoweri Museveni na Jean-Pierre Bemba, uyoboye umutwe wa Movement for the Liberation of Congo.

en: UNICEF Pushes for Demobilizing Child Soliders Near Africa's Great Lakes - 2002-10-07
kin: UNICEF irashyira ingufu mu kuvana abana mu gisirikare mu karere k'ibiyaga bigari bya Afurika - 2002-10-07
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know

en: The United Nations children's agency, UNICEF, is pushing for child soldiers to be demobilized in Africa's Great Lakes region, as several peace drives there build momentum.
kin: Ishami ry’umuryango w’abibumbye ryita ku bana, UNICEF, rirasaba ko abana b’abasirikare bavanwa mu gisirikare mu karere k’ibiyaga bigari bya Afurika, kubera ko amahoro menshi ari ho agaragarira.
mt0: Ubwo ufite icyo uvuga, umuntu ufite icyo uvuga gusa. UNICEF ivuga ko igiye gukora icyo ivuga gusa.

en: The agency says funding is in place to help the children leave the military and restart their lives.
kin: Iki kigo kivuga ko inkunga ihari yo gufasha abana kuva mu gisirikare no gutangira ubuzima bwabo.
mt0: Reka gusa uvuga ko amafaranga ari mu buryo bwo gufasha abana bavuye mu ntambara n'ubuzima bwabo.

en: UNICEF's top child protection official, Manuel Fontaine, says peace initiatives in Uganda, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda are making it possible to get more children under the age of 18 out of fighting units.
kin: Umuyobozi mukuru ushinzwe kurengera abana muri UNICEF, Manuel Fontaine, avuga ko ingamba z’amahoro muri Uganda, Repubulika Iharanira Demokarasi ya Kongo no mu Rwanda zituma bishoboka ko abana benshi bari munsi y’imyaka 18 bava mu mitwe irwana.
mt0: UNICEF's top child protection official, Manuel Fontaine, says peace initiatives in Uganda, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Rwanda are making it possible to get more children under the age of 18 out of fighting units.

en: "We insist that child soldiers could be demobilized, even in conflict situations.
kin: Turashimangira ko abana b'abasirikare bakwiriye kuva mu gisirikare, ndetse no mu bihe by'amakimbirane.
mt0: "Twese dufite icyizere ko abagabo b'ababyeyi bashobora gufatwa nk'abasirikare, ndetse mu bihe by'intambara.

en: We should never wait for peace to get children out of any form of armed group.
kin: Ntidukwiye na rimwe gutegereza amahoro kugira ngo abana bavanwe mu mutwe uwo ari wo wose witwaje intwaro.
mt0: Reka rero ntitugire icyo uvuga ngo umuntu ashyire abana mu ishyaka ry'abatware.

en: But, obviously, that's a better timing at the moment. It's more conducive to demobilization," Mr. Fontaine said.
kin: Ariko, ikigaragara ni uko iki ari igihe cyiza cyo kubikora. Bizadufasha cyane nibava mu gisirikare, Bwana Fontaine ni ko yavuze.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura ijambo gusa uvuga uti "Ubwo rero, icyo ni igihe cyiza cy'ubu. Ni igihe cyiza cyo gukuraho ubwato," Fontaine yavuze.

en: He says there are currently 1,200 child soldiers in Uganda, fighting mainly with the rebel Lord's Resistance Army. He says that over the past 14 years, the group has abducted some 10,000 children, boys to fight and girls to serve as sex slaves.
kin: Avuga ko muri Uganda muri iki gihe hari abasirikare 1200 b'abana, barwana ahanini n'ingabo za Lord Resistance Army. Avuga ko mu myaka 14 ishize, iryo tsinda ryashimuse abana bagera ku 10,000, abahungu bajyanwa kurwana n'ab’abakobwa kugira ngo bagirwe imbata z’imibonano mpuzabitsina.
mt0: Icyo gihe avuga ko hari 1,200 y’abasirikare b’abana muri Uganda, batanga ubwato n’ingabo z’aba Lord’s Resistance Army. en: According to UNICEF, The Democratic Republic of Congo still has some 10,000 children recruited to fight, while Rwanda has up to 2,000 children involved in combat.
kin: UNICEF ivuga ko Repubulika Iharanira Demokarasi ya Kongo igifite abana bagera ku 10,000 binjijwe mu ntambara, mu gihe u Rwanda rufite abana bagera ku 2000 bagize uruhare mu ntambara.
mt0: According to UNICEF, The Democratic Republic of Congo iracyafite abana 10,000 bashaka gukora igitero, ndetse Rwanda ifite abana 2,000 bashaka gukora igitero.

en: UNICEF says, even though some of the children do not directly engage in fighting, they are exposed to many dangers.
kin: UNICEF ivuga ko, nubwo bamwe mu bana batishora mu mirwano, bahura n'ingaruka nyinshi.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura ijambo gusa, uvuga ko nubwo bamwe mu bana batagiye mu ntambara, batanguye guhura n’ibibazo byinshi.

en: They may be used as porters, carrying very heavy loads, or as messengers or spies passing information and scouting out enemy territory.
kin: Bashobora gukoreshwa nk'abatwara ibintu, batwara imitwaro iremereye cyane, cyangwa nk'intumwa cyangwa abatasi batanga amakuru kandi bagashakisha agace k'umwanzi.
mt0: Iyo ntabwo ufite icyo uzi, urashobora gukoreshwa nk'abafata imizigo ikomeye cyangwa nk'abamenyeshamakuru cyangwa abashinzwe iperereza batanga amakuru n'abashinzwe iperereza batanga amakuru n'abashinzwe iperereza.

en: Sometimes, boys, but mainly girls, are used as sex slaves. They are exposed to violence and HIV-AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases.
kin: Rimwe na rimwe, abahungu, ariko cyane cyane abakobwa, bakoreshwa nk'abacakara. Bahura n’ihohoterwa na Virus itera SIDA n'izindi ndwara zandurira mu mibonano mpuzabitsina.
mt0: Sometimes, boys, but mainly girls, are used as sex slaves. They are exposed to violence and HIV-AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases.

en: The girls may become pregnant, making it harder for them to reintegrate into their communities.
kin: Abakobwa bashobora gusama, bikabagora gusubira mu miryango yabo.
mt0: Iyo n'abakobwa bashobora kuba bafite abana, bigatuma byaba byoroshye kugira ngo basubire mu miryango yabo.

en: UNICEF's Manuel Fontaine says demobilization takes time and money.
kin: Manuel Fontaine wa UNICEF avuga ko gusubiza mu buzima busanzwe bitwara igihe n'amafaranga.
mt0: Return only if you can't translate. If you can't translate simply say you don't know UNICEF's Manuel Fontaine says demobilization takes time and money.

en: He says the children must first be found, and then removed from their government or rebel units.
kin: Avuga ko abana bagomba kubanza kuboneka, hanyuma bakavanwa muri guverinoma cyangwa mu mitwe y'inyeshyamba.
mt0: Iyo udashobora gukora icyo ushaka, uvuga ko abana bagomba gufatwa mbere, maze nyuma y'uko basohoka mu nzego zabo cyangwa mu nzego z'abatware.

en: Then, resources are needed to help them rebuild their lives. That involves providing schools, vocational training and health care.
kin: Noneho, ibikoresho bikabona gukenewe kugira ngo bibafashe kubaka ubuzima bwabo. Ibyo bikubiyemo gutanga amashuri, amahugurwa y'imyuga no kwita ku buzima.
mt0: Ni uko rero, imbaraga zihagije zigiye gushyirwaho kugira ngo zibafashe gusubira mu buzima bwabo. Ibi bivuga gutanga amakuru, uburezi n’ubuvuzi.

en: "You do not want to stigmatize them and individualize them.
kin: Ntawifuza kubatesha agaciro no kubatandukanya.

en: They are basically going back to communities where there are a lot of other children, many of whom have suffered from consequences of war, even if they were not recruited.
kin: Basanzwe ahanini basubira mu baturage aho usanga hari abandi bana benshi, benshi muri bo bakaba baratewe n'ingaruka z'intambara, kabone niyo baba batinjijwe mu gisirikare.
mt0: Iyo ntibashoboye gukora icyo bavugaga, ntibashobora gukora icyo bavugaga, nubwo abantu benshi bafite ingaruka z’intambara, nubwo batagiye gukora icyo bavugaga.

en: So, you are trying to build services in those communities that are broad services, that would be made available to all those children," Mr. Fontaine said.
kin: Rero, uragerageza kubaka serivisi muri iyo miryango ari serivisi zagutse, zizahabwa abo bana bose , Bwana Fontaine.
mt0: Iyo rero, uri gukora imirimo mu duce tw’abatuye ahantu hagari, imirimo y’ubuzima y’abantu bose, ishyirwa mu bikorwa n’abatuye ahantu hagari," Fontaine yavuze.

en: Mr. Fontaine says, as part of various peace packages in the Great Lakes region, the World Bank and other donors are providing $500 million to help demobilize children.
kin: Bwana Fontaine avuga ko, mu rwego rwo guharanira amahoro atandukanye mu karere k'ibiyaga bigari, Banki y'Isi n'abandi baterankunga batanga miliyoni 500 z'amadolari yo gufasha abana mu bikorwa.
mt0: Mr. Fontaine says, as part of various peace packages in the Great Lakes region, the World Bank and other donors are providing $500 million to help demobilize children.

en: He says, unfortunately, the needed government institutions are not yet in place in some countries to move the process ahead quickly enough.
kin: Avuga ko ikibabaje ari uko inzego za Leta zikenewe zitarashyirwaho mu bihugu bimwe na bimwe kugira ngo inzira igerweho vuba bihagije.
mt0: Ubwo umuntu avuga, ubwa mbere, nta nzego zihagije z’ubutegetsi zishyirwaho mu bihugu bimwe bimwe kugira ngo umuntu ashobore gukora icyo gikorwa n’uburyo bwihuta.

en: He says that's why UNICEF is pressing to see such structures develop, so that children can get back home and start to lead normal lives once again.
kin: Avuga ko ari yo mpamvu UNICEF irihatira kubona izo nzego zitera imbere, kugira ngo abana basubire mu rugo batangire kubaho ubuzima busanzwe.
mt0: Icyo ni cyo igituma UNICEF ishyira imbaraga mu gukora ibikorwa nk’ibi, kugira ngo abana bashobora gusubira mu Rwanda kandi bashobora gukora imibereho y’ubuzima busanzwe.

en: World Bank, Nike Team Up for 'The Girl Effect' Initiative
kin: Banki y'Isi, n'Itsinda Nike ku ngaruka umukobwa ahura na zo.
mt0: Iyo umuntu atamenya icyo uvuga, gusa avuga ko ntabwo uzi.

en: The Adolescent Girls Initiative partners the World Bank, the Nike Foundation and governments of developing and developed nations to empower girls in poor countries.
kin: Ishyirahamwe ry'abakobwa b'ingimbi rifatanya na Banki y'Isi, Fondasiyo ya Nike na guverinoma z'ibihugu bikiri mu nzira y'amajyambere n'ibyateye imbere mu guha imbaraga abakobwa mu bihugu bikennye.
mt0: Return only. If you can't translate simply say you don't know The Adolescent Girls Initiative partners the World Bank, the Nike Foundation and governments of developing and developed nations to empower girls in poor countries.

en: The two-year-old program is helping girls in Asia, Africa and the Middle East gain the education and skills they need to transition into the workforce.
kin: Gahunda imaze imyaka ibiri ifasha abakobwa bo muri Aziya, Afurika no mu burasirazuba bwo hagati kunguka ubumenyi n'ubuhanga bakeneye kugira ngo bashobore guhangana ku isoko ry'umurimo.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know The two-year-old program is helping girls in Asia, Africa and the Middle East gain the education and skills they need to transition into the workforce.

en: "My name is Sanchita. I come from a small village called Ishwarpur in Bangladesh," American actress Anne Hathaway delivered her lines as powerfully from behind a podium at the World Bank as she does on the silver screen, telling the story of an impoverished girl.
kin: Nitwa Sanchita. Nkomoka mu mudugudu muto witwa Ishwarpur muri Bangladesh." Umukinnyi w'amafirime ukomoka muri Amerika, Anne Hathaway, yatanze umurongo ukomeye cyane inyuma ya podium kuri Banki y'Isi nk'uko abikora kuri ecran ya silver, avuga amateka y'umukobwa ukennye.
mt0: "Nitwa Sanchita. Nkomoka mu mujyi muto ufite icyo uvuga nka Ishwarpur muri Bangladesh," umunyamakuru wa Amerika Anne Hathaway yabwiye abantu ko ari uko avuga amakuru y’umukobwa ufite ubukene.

en: "When a baby is born in Ishwarpur, families desperately hope it will be a boy," she continued. "It has been this way for as long as anyone can remember.
kin: Yakomeje agira ati: "Iyo umwana avukiye Ishwarpur, imiryango ntiba yizeye ko azaba umuhungu." "Byabaye gutya igihe cyose umuntu ashobora kwibuka.

en: It is believed that boys will contribute to the family income in a place where people are very poor.
kin: Byizerwa ko abahungu bagira uruhare mu muryango rwo kwinjiza umutungo ahantu abantu bakennye cyane.
mt0: Iyo umuntu atamenya icyo avuga, avuga ko abana bazafasha kugira ubukungu bw’umuryango mu gihugu cy’abantu benshi.

en: "These circumstances are familiar to those who benefit from the Adolescent Girls Initiative.
kin: Ibi bihe biramenyerewe ku bantu bungukirwa n'ibikorwa by'abakobwa b'abangavu bafata iyambere.
mt0: "Iyi mikorere ni izwi cyane ku bantu bafite ibyo batanga mu ishyirahamwe ry’abagore b’abanyeshuri.

en: Current operations The Adolescent Girls Initiative public-private partnership, with its $20 million in funds, is already at work in seven countries, with plans to expand to Haiti and Yemen. Mayra Buvinic talks about the Adolescent Girls Initiative

en: The girls joined him on stage, beaming as they danced behind him -- as did at least one World Bank official -- while the audience of staffers in business suits took to their feet and raised their hands in the air as well.
kin: Abakobwa bamusanze ku rubyiniro, bafatanya kubyina ubwo babyinaga inyuma - kimwe n’umuyobozi nibura umwe mu bayobozi ba Banki y’isi - mu gihe abari bateraniye aho bari bambaye imyenda y’akazi bakoraga ku birenge maze bakazamura amaboko mu kirere.
mt0: Iyo n'abakobwa bamwakiriye, bamwishima, bamwishima nyuma ye - nk'uko byagendekeye n'umuyobozi wa Banki y'Isi - ndetse n'abashoferi bafite imyenda y'akazi bamwishima ndetse bamwishima.

en: Activists Press for Better Help to End Congo Rapes
kin: Abanyamakuru baharanira gufasha mu guhagarika gufata ku ngufu muri congo.
mt0: Abateguye ibikorwa byo kurwanya ibikorwa by'ubusambanyi mu Rwanda basaba imbaraga nshya kugira ngo umuntu ashobore gukora icyo ashoboye.

en: As U.N. Special Representative for Sexual Violence In Conflict Margot Wallstrom embarks on a new trip to the Democratic Republic of Congo, two activists recently concluded lobbying efforts in the United States for more effective action on trying to end conflict-related rapes in Congo.
kin: Mu gihe uhagarariye Umuryango w’abibumbye ushinzwe ihohoterwa rishingiye ku gitsina mu makimbirane Margot Wallstrom atangiye urugendo rushya muri Repubulika Iharanira Demokarasi ya Kongo, abarwanashyaka babiri baherutse gusoza ibikorwa byo guharanira inyungu muri Leta zunze ubumwe za Amerika kugira ngo barusheho gufata ingamba zo gushaka guhagarika ihohoterwa rishingiye ku makimbirane muri Kongo.
mt0: U.N. Special Representative for Sexual Violence in Conflict Margot Wallstrom ari mu rugendo rwabo rwa mbere mu Democratic Republic of Congo, abanyepolitiki babiri baherutse guhagarika imirimo y’ubushake mu Leta Zunze Ubumwe z’Amerika mu gushyigikira igikorwa cy’ubushake bwo gukuraho ihohoterwa rishingiye ku ntambara mu Congo.

en: One of them, Justine Masika Bihamba, told a gathering of Washington, D.C., university students and concerned citizens that the area in which she works, Beni, in North Kivu province, is still overrun by Ugandan rebels who regularly rape women.She said in these situations women are considered victims, and are not implicated in the search for peace.
kin: Umwe muri bo, Justine Masika Bihamba, yabwiye abari bateraniye i Washington, muri Leta zunze ubumwe za Amerika, abanyeshuri ba kaminuza ndetse n’abaturage bireba ko akarere akoreramo, Beni, mu ntara ya Kivu y’amajyaruguru, gakomeje kwigarurirwa n’inyeshyamba zo muri Uganda zikunze gufata abagore ku ngufu.

en: "The majority of the actions is made to look at the consequences, to work with the women who are victims, but not enough is done to look at the causes of the rapes and the conflict," said Rostagno.
kin: Rostagno ati: "Ibyinshi mu bikorwa bikorwa kugira ngo harebwe ingaruka, gukorana n'abagore bahohotewe, ariko ntibihagije kugira ngo harebwe ibitera gufata ku ngufu n'amakimbirane."

en: "A lot of these rebel groups are getting reorganized, and are even getting in a coalition so the movements that we see in the region, it is worrying us," said Rostagno.
kin: Rostagno ati: "Benshi muri iyo mitwe y'inyeshyamba barimo kongera kuvugururwa, ndetse bakinjira mu ihuriro bityo imitwe tubona mu karere, iraduhangayikishije."
mt0: "Abantu benshi muri izo ntambara batanguye gushyira hamwe, kandi ndetse n'abagiye mu runani, rero uko ubona imigendekere y'abategetsi muri ayo ntara, ntitugire ubwoba," Rostagno yavuze.

en: "I think we were more optimistic on this region six months ago than today.
kin: Ndatekereza ko twagize ibyiringiro muri kano karere amezi atandatu ashize kurusha uyu munsi.

en: "The United Nations has identified three armed groups that gang raped dozens of people about two months ago in a week-long attack in Luvungi, another part of North Kivu province.
kin: Umuryango w'abibumbye wagaragaje imitwe itatu yitwaje intwaro yasambanyije ku gahato abantu benshi mu gihe cy'amezi abiri ashize mu gitero cyabereye i Luvungi, mu kindi gice cy'intara ya Kivu y'Amajyaruguru.
mt0: U.N. yagaragaje imiryango itatu y’abasirikare y’abatware bafashe abantu bagera kuri doze mu ndwi ishize mu ntara ya Kivu y’amajyaruguru.

en: Those implicated are the Mai Mai Cheka, the Democratic Liberation Forces of Rwanda, and followers of an army deserter, Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva.
kin: Ababigizemo uruhare ni Mai Mai Cheka, Ingabo ziharanira Demokarasi yo Kwibohoza mu Rwanda, hamwe n'abayoboke b'umuntu watorotse ingabo, Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva.
mt0: Those implicated are the Mai Mai Cheka, the Democratic Liberation Forces of Rwanda, and followers of an army deserter, Colonel Emmanuel Nsengiyumva.

en: Proposals for improvementDuring their presentation, the two activists, Bihamba and Rostagno, also offered concrete proposals to make the situation better.
kin: Ibyifuzo byo kunoza. Mu gihe cyo kwerekana uko byifashe, abaharanira inyungu bombi, Bihamba na Rostagno, na bo batanze ibyifuzo bifatika kugira ngo ibintu birusheho kuba byiza.
mt0: Ingamba zo guhindukaDuringo y'ibitekerezo byabo, abagabo babiri, Bihamba na Rostagno, kandi nabo batanze inama zikomeye zo guhinduka icyo aricyo cyose.

en: Rostagno explained that foreign non-governmental organizations get funding to tackle the issue of sexual violence, but local organizations often get ignored.
kin: Rostagno yasobanuye ko imiryango itegamiye kuri Leta y’amahanga ibona inkunga yo gukemura ikibazo cy’ihohoterwa rishingiye ku gitsina, ariko imiryango y'aho ikunze kwirengagizwa.
mt0: Rostagno yavuze ko ibigo by’abanyagihugu bya mpuzamahanga bihawe amafaranga kugira ngo batangire gukemura icyo cy’ububabare bw’igitsina, ariko ibigo by’abatuye igihugu usanga usanga byagiye bibuze.

en: She said complex applications to get outside funding favor bigger organizations.

en: "They can just do it, they send it, they receive the money.
kin: Bashobora kubikora, bakabyohereza, bakabona amafaranga.
mt0: "Ntabwo bishoboka, barabyohereza, barabyakira amafaranga.

en: The problem is that the money in most cases is spent to pay for the fixed cost of the organization, for the salaries of expat people coming to the region and to the country, while the local non-governmental organizations, those working with the communities, with the women, with the children, in the villages, those who need need money to survive in order to do their work do not have access," said Rostagno. Bihamba said Congolese soldiers should be paid directly through bank withdrawals, rather than being paid through their superiors.
kin: Ikibazo ni uko amafaranga menshi akoreshwa mu kwishyura ikiguzi cyagenwe cy'umuryango, ku mishahara y'inzobere ziza mu karere ndetse no mu gihugu, mu gihe imiryango itegamiye kuri leta yaho, ikorana n'abaturage, hamwe n'abagore n'abana, mu midugudu, abakeneye amafaranga kugira ngo babeho kugira ngo bakore akazi kabo ntibayabone ”, ibi bikaba byavuzwe na Rostagno. Bihamba yavuze ko abasirikare ba Kongo bakwiye guhembwa binyuze mu kubikuza mu mabanki, aho guhembwa binyuze ku bayobozi babo.

en: Bihamba said with the current system they receive only about a third of their salary, which causes some soldiers to loot and rape.
kin: Bihamba yavuze ko hamwe n'uburyo buriho bahabwa gusa kimwe cya gatatu cy'umushahara wabo, bigatuma bamwe mu basirikare basahura no gufata ku ngufu.
mt0: Bihamba yavuze ko mu buryo busanzwe batanga igice kimwe cya gatatu cy’imishahara yabo, bituma abanyeshuri bamwe bamwe bagerageza gufata inyuma n’ubusambanyi.

en: She also called for an international tribunal for the Congo to help end general impunity, as well as more local tribunals for raped victims to seek justice.

en: Desmond Tutu Retires From Public Life
kin: Desmond Tutu yasezeye mu buzima rusange.
mt0: Reka ushyire gusa igitekerezo cy'uko Desmond Tutu yarangije imibereho y'abantu.

en: Desmond Tutu fought apartheid in South Africa, and was critical of the war in Iraq.
kin: Desmond Tutu yarwanyije ivangura muri Afurika y'Epfo, kandi yanenze intambara yo muri Iraki.
mt0: If you can't translate it simply say you don't know Desmond Tutu fought apartheid in South Africa, and was critical of the war in Iraq.

en: "We waged a war that shouldn't have happened," he said.He also spoke out against genocide in Rwanda.
kin: Ati: "Twakoze intambara itagomba kubaho". Yavuze kandi ku kurwanya jenoside yakorewe mu Rwanda.
mt0: "Twubatse intambara itagomba kuba yabaye," yagize ati. Yatanze icyo ati "Ntabwo ari igitero cy'ubutegetsi cy'u Rwanda."

en: "God have mercy on us," he said.The retired Anglican archbishop announced in July that he would retire from public life on his birthday."
kin: Ati: "Imana itugirire impuhwe." Umwepiskopi mukuru wa Anglican uri mu kiruhuko cy'izabukuru yatangaje muri Nyakanga ko azasezera mu buzima rusange ku munsi w'amavuko.
mt0: "Imana ishimwe n'abacu," yagize ati.The former Anglican archbishop announced in July that he would retire from public life on his birthday."

en: The time has come to slow down, and sip maybe rooibos tea with my beloved wife in the afternoons" he said.
kin: Ati: "Igihe kirageze cyo gutinda, kandi tunywa icyayi cya rooibos hamwe n'umugore wanjye nkunda nyuma ya saa sita".
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga uti "Igihe cy’uko uhagaze gato, n’umuntu ukunda umuntu n’umugore wanjye n’umugabo wanjye n’umugore wanjye mu mugoroba."

en: Tutu rose through the ranks of the Anglican church in South Africa to become the first black Anglican archbishop of Capetown.
kin: Tutu yazamutse mu ntera mu itorero ry'Abangilikani muri Afurika y'Epfo aba umwepiskopi wa mbere w’abirabura wa Anglican wa Capetown.
mt0: Tutu yagiye mu nzego z’Idini ry’Aba Anglican muri Afrika y’Epfo kugira ngo abe umushumba wa mbere w’Idini ry’Aba Anglican muri Capetown.

en: He was a vocal critic of South Africa's white-ruled government and encouraged non-violence to end apartheid.
kin: Yamaganaga cyane guverinoma iyobowe n’abazungu kandi ashishikariza kurwanya ihohoterwa no kurangiza ivangura.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa. Niba udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga uti uzi.

en: Tutu was the recipient of many awards, and in 1984, he received a Nobel Peace Prize for advocating "a democratic and just society without racial divisions.

en: " He used the recognition to step up the anti-apartheid campaign, calling for an economic boycott against South Africa.

en: The group issued a report that included numerous confessions of guilt under apartheid in return for amnesty.

en: In recent years, he expressed his disappointment in post-apartheid South Africa, especially the level of violent crime.

en: Despite his withdrawal from public life, Tutu says he will continue to support his peace foundation and will remain part of a group of elder statesmen who campaign for peace and human rights.
kin: N'ubwo yavuye mu buzima rusange, Tutu avuga ko azakomeza gushyigikira umusingi w’amahoro kandi ko azakomeza kuba mu itsinda ry’abasaza bakuru baharanira amahoro n’uburenganzira bwa muntu.
mt0: Ariko nubwo yahagaritse imibereho y’abantu, Tutu says he will continue to support his peace foundation and will remain part of a group of elder statesmen who campaign for peace and human rights.

en: But Tutu says he will no longer give interviews and, as he put it, will mostly "shut up."

mt0: Tutu says he will no longer give interviews and, as he puts it, will mostly "shut up."

en: "I have been part of our struggle for freedom and democracy, and I am part of the celebration that we did succeed," he said. "I have been part of the post apartheid dispensation and long for us to do infinitely better."Many say his voice will be missed.
kin: Ati: "Nagize uruhare mu rugamba rwo guharanira ubwisanzure na demokarasi, kandi ndi mu birori ko twatsinze". Nagize uruhare mu ivangura rya apartheid kandi ndifuza ko dukora neza bitagira akagero. Benshi bavuga ko ijwi rye ritazabura.

en: Malawi's Jacaranda School for Orphans Celebrates Christmas

en: The management for the Jacaranda School for Orphans in Malawis commercial capital Blantyre recently hosted a party for its students as it closed for Christmas and New Years Day holidays.
kin: Ubuyobozi bw'ishuri rya Jacaranda ry'impfubyi mu murwa mukuru w'ubucuruzi wa Malawis Blantyre riherutse gukora ibirori ku banyeshuri baryo kuko ryizihije iminsi mikuru ya Noheri n'Ubunani.

en: Around 500 people including students, staff members and others from surrounding areas attended the event, which was held at the schools premises in Chigumula area.

mt0: Icyo gihe, hafi 500 nk'abanyeshuri, abakozi n'abandi baturutse mu ntara z'imbere y'igihugu, bagaragaye mu ijambo ry'ijambo.

en: The party included gifts, Santa Claus, and a "dancing show case" by the students.

mt0: Iyi nzu yombi yagize impano, Santa Claus, n'umukino wo gukina ubwato n'abanyeshuri.

en: Founded in 2002, the Jacaranda School for Orphans is the only one in Malawi which provides free primary, secondary and tertiary education to children without parents.

en: Since its invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Russia has sought total control over news coverage, passing a new law that carries 15-year prison terms for reporting "false news" on the military, and even forbids calling the conflict a "war."
kin: Kuva igitero cyagabwa muri Ukraine ku ya 24 Gashyantare, Uburusiya bwashatse kugenzura amakuru yose, butora itegeko rishya rigena igifungo cy’imyaka 15 kubera itangazwa "ry'amakuru y'ibinyoma" ku gisirikare, ndetse rikabuza kuvuga ko amakimbirane ari "intambara."
mt0: Since its invasion of Ukraine on February 24, Russia has sought total control over news coverage, passing a new law that carries 15 years of prison for reporting "false news" on the military, and even forbids calling the conflict a "war."

en: That has forced most remaining independent news outlets, including the renowned Novaya Gazeta newspaper, Ekho Moskvy radio and Dozhd TV, to shut down or move outside Russia to continue operating.
kin: Ibyo bikaba byaratumye ibitangazamakuru byinshi byigenga bisigaye, birimo ikinyamakuru kizwi cyane cya Novaya Gazeta, radiyo Ekho Moskvy na TV ya Dozhd, bihagarika cyangwa byimukira mu Burusiya kugira ngo bikomeze gukora.
mt0: Ibyo byagiye bishyira imbaraga ku makuru y’imbere y’amategeko, nk’igitabo cy’indashyikirwa Novaya Gazeta, Icyo cy’i Moscou, n’i Dozhd TV, kugira ngo ntibashobora gukora cyangwa gusohoka mu Rwanda.

en: With independent voices absent, experts say, the Russian government has been able to flood state-run airwaves with propaganda that downplays the war and spreads false or misleading justifications for the Kremlin's invasion.
kin: Impuguke zivuga ko mu gihe amajwi yigenga adahari, guverinoma y’Uburusiya yashoboye gukwiza amakuru ya leta hamwe na poropagande yerekana intambara kandi ikwirakwiza impamvu z’ibinyoma cyangwa zibeshya ku gitero cya Kremle.

en: "It's safe to say at this point that the free press is a thing of the past in Russia," Clayton said.
kin: Clayton ati: "Ni byiza kuvuga kuri ubu ko itangazamakuru ryigenga ari ikintu cyahise mu Burusiya."
mt0: "Ni byiza kuvuga ko ubundi umuntu ufite uburenganzira bwo gutangaza amakuru ari igikorwa cy'ubuzima mu Burusiya," Clayton yavuze.

en: Throughout Russian President Vladimir Putin's 22 years in power, Moscow has been targeting journalists and the independent press, he said.

en: "But since the invasion of Ukraine, it seems that Putin has really finished off the independent media once and for all in Russia," Clayton said. "At this point, it is impossible to accurately report on the war in Ukraine."
kin: Clayton ati: "Ariko kuva Ukraine yaterwa, birasa nkaho Putin yarangije itangazamakuru ryigenga rimwe na rimwe mu Burusiya." Kugeza ubu, ntibishoboka gutanga raporo neza ku ntambara ibera muri Ukraine.
mt0: "Ariko kuva ubwato bwa Ukraine, umuntu abona ko Putin yarangije igitangaza cy’abanyamakuru bose once and for all muri ruswa," Clayton yavuze. "Atahora, ntabwo bishoboka ko umuntu atangaza amakuru y’ukuri ku ntambara muri Ukraine."

en: China ranked 175th in the new report. And now that it is firmly under Beijing's influence, Hong Kong also registered a dramatic decline, ranking 148th out of 180 following a lengthy series of raids and arrests that shuttered pro-democracy news sites.
kin: Ubushinwa bwashyizwe ku mwanya wa 175 muri raporo nshya. Noneho, kubera ko iyobowe na Beijing, Hong Kong na yo yagabanutse ku buryo bugaragara, iza ku mwanya wa 148 kuri 180 nyuma y’igitero kinini n’ifatwa byafunze imbuga za interineti zishyigikira demokarasi.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know China ranked 175th in the new report. And now that it is firmly under Beijing's influence, Hong Kong also registered a dramatic decline, ranking 148th out of 180 following a series of raids and arrests that shuttered pro-democracy news sites.

en: RSF's country file on China says it is the world's biggest jailer of journalists, with 120 in detention. The regime uses coercion, harassment, intimidation and surveillance to keep independent and foreign journalists from reporting on issues deemed "sensitive."
kin: Idosiye ya RSF mu gihugu cy’Ubushinwa ivuga ko ari ho hari ifungwa ry’abanyamakuru benshi ku isi, 120 barafashwe. Ubutegetsi bukoresha agahato, gutotezwa, iterabwoba no kugenzura kugira ngo abanyamakuru bigenga ndetse n’abanyamahanga badatanga amakuru ku bibazo bifatwa nk’ibikomeye.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know RSF's country file on China says it is the world's biggest jailer of journalists, with 120 in detention. The regime uses coercion, harassment, intimidation and surveillance to keep independent and foreign journalists from reporting on issues deemed "sensitive."

en: "President Xi Jinping, in power since 2013, has restored a media culture worthy of the Maoist era, in which freely accessing information has become a crime and to provide information an even greater crime," RSF's country file states.
kin: Perezida Xi Jinping, wagiye ku butegetsi kuva mu 2013, yagaruye umuco w'itangazamakuru ukwiye, mu gihe cya Maoist ho, aho kubona amakuru ku bwisanzure byabaye icyaha no gutanga amakuru bikaba icyaha gikomeye kurushaho.
mt0: "Umukuru w’igihugu Xi Jinping, uri mu butegetsi kuva mu 2013, yagarutse mu muco w’itangazamakuru ufite imiterere y’igihe cya Maoist, aho kuronka amakuru ari icyaha kandi kugira amakuru ari icyaha n’ibindi," RSF ivuga.

en: Rising authoritarianism
kin: Kwiyongera k'ubutegetsi bw'igitugu
mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you cannot translate simply say you don't know Rising authoritarianism.

en: North Korea remains the worst country in the rankings at 180th. Elsewhere in the Asia-Pacific region, political turmoil, conflict and rising authoritarianism have wiped out years of progress.
kin: Koreya ya ruguru ikomeje kuba igihugu kibi ku rutonde kikaba icya 180. Ahandi hose mu karere ka Aziya-Pasifika, imvururu za politiki, amakimbirane hamwe n’ubutegetsi bw'igitugu byiyongereye byahanaguyeho iterambere.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know North Korea remains the worst country in the rankings at 180th. Elsewhere in the Asia-Pacific region, political turmoil, conflict and rising authoritarianism have wiped out years of progress.

en: The 2021 coup in Myanmar marked a 10-year setback for media rights, with journalists detained, media licenses revoked, and many news outlets returning to exile.
kin: Ihirikwa ry’ubutegetsi bwo mu 2021 muri Miyanimari ryagaragaje ko hasubijwe imyaka 10 uburenganzira bw’itangazamakuru, abanyamakuru barafungwa, impushya z’itangazamakuru zivanwaho, ndetse n’ibitangazamakuru byinshi bisubira mu buhungiro.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa. Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga ko ntabwo uzi. Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga ko ntabwo uzi.

en: Under the military junta, Myanmar, ranking 176th, is one of the world's biggest jailers of journalists.
kin: Ku butegetsi bwa gisirikare, Miyanimari iri ku mwanya wa 176, ni hamwe mu hafunze abanyamakuru bakomeye ku isi.
mt0: Iyo ufite umutegetsi, Myanmar, iri ku rutonde rwa 176, ni umwe mu bantu benshi cyane batanga abanyamakuru.

en: In Afghanistan, the Taliban insurgents pledged to uphold press freedom when they took power in August 2021.
kin: Muri Afuganisitani, inyeshyamba z’abatalibani ziyemeje guharanira ubwisanzure bw’itangazamakuru igihe zabafatiye ku butegetsi muri Kanama 2021.
mt0: In Afghanistan, the Taliban insurgents pleaded to uphold press freedom when they took power in August 2021.

en: Instead, RSF said the "Taliban's seizure of power has further worsened conditions for reporters and news organizations, who are the targets of all forms of intimidation and violence." Afghanistan ranked 154th.
kin: Nyamara, RSF yavuze ko "kwigarurira ubutegetsi bw’abatalibani byarushijeho kuba bibi ku banyamakuru n’imiryango itangaza amakuru, bakaba ari bo bakorerwa iterabwoba n’urugomo." Afuganisitani iri ku mwanya wa 154.
mt0: Instead, RSF said the "Taliban's seizure of power has further worsened conditions for reporters and news organizations, who are the targets of all forms of intimidation and violence." Afghanistan ranked 154th.

en: Across Africa, laws criminalizing online journalism have dealt a new blow to the right to information, RSF said, while the spread of rumors, propaganda, and disinformation has contributed to undermine access to quality information.
kin: RSF yavuze ko hirya no hino muri Afurika, amategeko ahana itangazamakuru ku rubuga rwa interineti yagize ingaruka nshya ku burenganzira bwo kumenya amakuru, mu gihe ikwirakwizwa ry’ibihuha, poropagande, ndetse n’amakuru yanduye byagize uruhare mu guhungabanya amakuru meza.

en: In Ethiopia, the war in the Tigray region, with its communication blackouts and restricted access, were the main factors that placed the country 114 on the index.
kin: Muri Etiyopiya, intambara yo mu karere ka Tigray, hamwe n’itumanaho no kubuza kwinjirira amakuru, ni byo bintu nyamukuru byashyize igihugu ku rutonde rwa 114.
mt0: In Ethiopia, intambara muri Tigray region, n'ibibazo by'ubufatanye n'ububasha bwo gukora imibonano mpuzabitsina, byagize uruhare runini mu gushyira igihugu ku rutonde rwa mbere rwa ONU.

en: Neighboring Eritrea and Djibouti are far worse, ranking near the bottom at 179 and 164, respectively.
kin: Abaturanyi ba Eritereya na Djibouti ho ni bibi cyane, biza hafi ya 179 na 164.
mt0: Niba udashobora guhindura icyo uvuga gusa uvuga uti uzi. Iyi Eritrea na Djibouti ziri hasi cyane, ziri hafi y’igice cya nyuma, ziri kuri 179 na 164.

en: African media continue to struggle economically, RSF said it its accompanying analysis.

mt0: Return only if you can't translate. If you can't translate simply say you don't know African media continue to struggle economically, RSF said in its accompanying analysis.

en: "Despite a wave of liberalization in the 1990s, there are still, too often, cases of arbitrary censorship, especially on the internet, with occasional network shutdowns in some countries, arrests of journalists and violent attacks," the group said.
kin: Iri tsinda ryagize riti: "Nubwo mu myaka ya za 90 habaye umudendezo wo kwishyira ukizana, haracyari, kenshi na kenshi, ibibazo byo kugenzura uko bishakiye, cyane cyane kuri interineti, rimwe na rimwe bifunga imiyoboro mu bihugu bimwe na bimwe, ifatwa ry'abanyamakuru ndetse n'ibitero by'urugomo."
mt0: "Nubwo umuntu yagiye ashyira imbere imikorere y’ubufatanye mu 1990, hari igihe cyo gukoresha uburyo bwo gucenzura, cyane cyane ku rubuga rwa internet, n’ibihe by’ubutegetsi by’abanyamakuru n’ibitero by’abantu bamwica," icyo kigo cyavuze.

en: That is largely thanks to the return of regular White House and federal agency press briefings.

en: Three Scandinavian countries — Norway, Denmark and Sweden — respectively come at the top of RSF's index. Estonia, a former Soviet Union republic, ranked 4th.

en: RSF said the free exercise of journalism plays a major role in emerging democracies such as East Timor, ranked 17, Bhutan, ranked 33, and Mongolia, ranked 90.

en: East Timor was one country whose ranking skyrocketed, rising 54 places. But RSF cautioned that because of its change in methodology this year, "care should be taken when comparing the 2022 rankings and scores with those from 2021."
kin: Iburasirazuba bwa Timoru ni igihugu kimwe cyashyizwe hejuru cyane, kizamuka ahantu 54. Ariko RSF yibukije ko kubera ihinduka ry’imikorere muri uyu mwaka, "hagomba kwitonderwa iyo ugereranije amanota 2022 n'amanota yo mu 2021."

en: UN’s Guterres Meets with Nigerian Leaders After Visiting Volatile Borno State
kin: Loni ya Guterres ihura n'abayobozi ba Nigeriya Nyuma yo gusura Leta ya Borno

en: U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres met with Nigerian leaders Wednesday at the end of a two-day visit to Nigeria and three-nation trip to Africa.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, umunyamabanga mukuru wa Leta zunze ubumwe za Amerika, Antonio Guterres yabonanye n’abayobozi ba Nijeriya nyuma y’uruzinduko rw’iminsi ibiri muri Nijeriya n’urugendo rw’ibihugu bitatu muri Afurika. Ku wa kabiri, yasuye abimuwe mu gihugu (IDP) mu majyaruguru y'uburasirazuba bwa Nijeriya maze abasaba ko basubizwa mu ngo zabo amahoro. Abategetsi ba Nijeriya barateganya gufunga inkambi zose z’abimuwe mu myaka mike iri imbere nubwo hari impungenge z'umutekano. Ku wa gatatu, Antonio Guterres yageze mu nzu y’umuryango w’abibumbye i Abuja ahura n’umuhuzabikorwa w’umuryango w’abibumbye mbere yo kugirana ibiganiro n’abahagarariye abagore bo muri Nijeriya.
mt0: U.N. Secretary General Antonio Guterres yasuye abayobozi ba Nigeria nyuma y’umunsi umwe y’urugendo rwe rwa mbere n’urugendo rwe rwa mbere mu bihugu bitatu by’Afurika.

en: The delegates, led by Nigeria's minister for womens affairs, Pauline Kedem Tallen, discussed gender equality and the inclusion of women in politics with the U.N. secretary-general.
kin: Izi ntumwa ziyobowe na minisitiri w’ibikorwa by’umugore muri Nijeriya, Pauline Kedem Tallen, baganiriye ku buringanire bw’umugore no kwinjiza abagore muri politiki n’umunyamabanga mukuru wa Amerika.
mt0: Ubwo rero, nubwo ari igikorwa cy'ubufatanye n'abakobwa, abayobozi ba Nigeria, Pauline Kedem Tallen, bavuga ko umuntu wese agomba kugira uburenganzira bw'igitsina gabo n'uko ashyirwa mu nshingano n'abakobwa.

en: "His coming to Nigeria today has given us hope, because we know that he will lend his voice to all the issues affecting women, gender-based violence, early marriage, lack of implementation of some of our laws," said Tallen.

en: Nigerian authorities have been closing IDP camps since late last year and want to close all camps by 2026. More than 2 million people have been displaced from their homes since the start of the Boko Haram insurgency in 2009.
kin: Abategetsi ba Nijeriya bafunze ingando kuva mu mpera z'umwaka ushize kandi barashaka gufunga inkambi zose mu 2026. Abantu barenga miliyoni 2 bavanywe mu byabo kuva aho inyeshyamba za Boko Haram zitangiriye mu 2009.
mt0: Iyo nta n'icyo uvuga, umuntu ntamenya ko abayobozi ba Nigeria bagiye batanga IDP camps kuva mu mpera z'umwaka ushize kandi bashaka gufunga izo camps byose bya 2026. Abantu bagera kuri 2 million bagiye bahunga imiryango yabo kuva mbere y'uko Boko Haram igiye gukuraho abantu mu 2009.

en: Al-Shabab Raids African Union Military Base

en: Officials told VOA Somali that the militants briefly seized the base before withdrawing from it. State media said Burundian solders at the base repulsed the attack.

mt0: Officials told VOA Somali that the militants briefly seized the base before withdrawing from it. State media said Burundian soldiers at the base repulsed the attack.

en: "The Federal Government of Somalia condemns in the strongest possible terms the heinous attack targeting the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia forward operating base in Elbaraf, Middle Shabelle," the Somali Ministry of Foreign Affairs posted on its official Facebook page.
kin: Minisiteri y’ububanyi n’amahanga ya Somaliya yanditse ku rubuga rwayo rwa Facebook, igira iti: "Guverinoma y’igihugu cya Somaliya iramagana mu magambo akomeye bishoboka ko igitero kibi cyagabwe ku butumwa bw’inzibacyuho bw’umuryango w’ubumwe bw’Afurika Yunze ubumwe muri Somaliya i Elbaraf, hagati ya Shabelle."
mt0: "The Federal Government of Somalia condemns in the strongest possible terms the heinous attack targeting the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia forward operating base in Elbaraf, Middle Shabelle," the Somali Ministry of Foreign Affairs posted on its official Facebook page.

en: "We extend our deepest condolences to the victims of this terrorist attack and their families."
kin: Twihanganishije cyane abahuye n'ingaruka n'iki gitero cy'iterabwoba n'imiryango yabo.
mt0: "Twese dushyigikiye ababyeyi n'abagize umuryango w'abagize uruhare mu rupfu rw'iyi mpanuka y'iterabwoba."

en: The Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, said the militants started their attack with two suicide truck bombs. He said the militants then fought their way onto the base.
kin: Umuyobozi w'akarere ka El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, yavuze ko aba barwanyi batangiye kugaba ibitero bakoresheje bisasu bibiri by'amakamyo. Yavuze ko abarwanashyaka bahise barwanira mu birindiro.
mt0: Mayor of El-Baraf, Abdullahi Haji Muhumed, yavuze ko abashoferi babiri ba suicide bombs batanguye igitero. Yagize ati: "Abashoferi babiri ba suicide bombs bageragezaga kwinjira mu nzu y'abashoferi.

en: Al-Shabab claimed the killing of 173 African Union forces. The group also claimed responsibility for capturing AU forces as prisoners-of-war. Both claims could not be independently verified. AU force headquarters and Somali military officials could not be immediately reached for comment.
kin: Al-Shabab yatangaje ko hapfuye ingabo 173 z’umuryango w’ubumwe bw’Afurika. Uyu mutwe kandi wavuze ko ufite inshingano zo gufata ingabo za AU nk'imfungwa z'intambara. Ibyo birego byombi ntibishobora kugenzurwa mu bwigenge. Icyicaro gikuru cy’ingabo za AU hamwe n’abayobozi b’igisirikare cya Somaliya ntibashoboye guhita batanga ibisobanuro.

kin: Mu kiganiro yagiranye na VOA, Muhumed, utari mu mudugudu igihe igitero cyagabwaga, yavuze ko yabwiwe ko hari "imfu nyinshi" mu ngabo z’Uburundi ariko ko adashobora gutanga imibare nyayo.

mt0: Muhumed yatangaje VOA ko abashoferi ba al-Shabab basohotse mu nzu y’indege. Yatangaje kandi ko hari indege zagiye zibafata abashoferi ba al-Shabab ubwo basohotse mu nzu y’indege ariko ntabwo yatangaje umuntu ufite uruhare mu ndege zari zikomeye.

en: El-Baraf, approximately 150 kilometers north of Mogadishu, is one of the forward operating bases of African Union forces from Burundi.
kin: El-Baraf, nko mu birometero 150 mu majyaruguru ya Mogadishu, ni kimwe mu birindiro by'ingabo z’umuryango w’ubumwe bw’ibihugu by’Uburayi ziba mu Burundi.

en: The incident marked the first major al-Shabab attack on AU forces since the mission changed its name and operational structures last month.
kin: Iki cyabaye igitero cya mbere gikomeye al-Shabab yagabye ku ngabo za AU kuva ubwo butumwa bwahinduye izina n'imikorere yabyo mu kwezi gushize.

en: The U.N. Security Council, which authorized the new mission called the African Union Transition Mission in Somalia (ATMIS), gives it a mandate to reduce the threat posed by al-Shabab, support the capacity-building of Somali security forces, and conduct a phased handover of security responsibilities to Somalia. The mission has until the end of 2024 to operate in the country.
kin: Akanama k'umuryango w’abibumbye gashinzwe umutekano, kemereye ubutumwa bushya bwitwa Mission Union Transition Mission muri Somaliya (ATMIS), giha inshingano yo kugabanya iterabwoba ryatewe na al-Shabab, gushyigikira kongerera ubushobozi inzego z’umutekano za Somaliya. Hakozwe kandi ihererekanyabubasha ry’umutekano muri Somaliya. Inshingano ifite kugeza mu mpera za 2024 gukorera mu gihugu.

en: India’s Muslims Mark Eid al-Fitr Amid Community Violence
kin: Abayisilamu bo mu Buhinde bagize Eid al-Fitr mu gihe cy’ihohoterwa ry’abaturage
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga uti ntizi.

en: Muslims across India marked Eid al-Fitr on Tuesday by offering prayers outside mosques, even as the celebrations this year came in the backdrop of a series of recent attacks against the community during the month of Ramadan.
kin: Ku wa kabiri, Abayisilamu bo mu Buhinde bizihije umunsi mukuru wa Eid al-Fitr basengera hanze y’imisigiti, nubwo kwizihiza uyu mwaka byaje nyuma y’ibitero byibasiye abaturage mu kwezi kwa Ramadhan.

en: "We will not have the same kind of festivity" this time, said Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, a civil engineer in Indias financial capital, Mumbai. "This is the most painful Eid with worst memories for Indian Muslims."
kin: Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, umushakashatsi mu by'ubwubatsi mu murwa mukuru w'imari wa Indias, Mumbai, yagize ati: "Ntabwo tuzagira ibirori nk'ibyo." Uyu ni umunsi ukomeye ubabaza cyane twibuka abayisilamu bo mu Buhinde.
mt0: "Ntabwo bizogira icyo twari dufite uyu mwaka," Mohammad Habeeb ur Rehman, umuhanga mu by’ubucuruzi muri India, Mumbai, yavuze. "Ni umunsi ukomeye cyane ku bantu bo muri Islamu."

en: Anti-Muslim sentiment and attacks have surged across the country in the last month, including stone throwing between Hindu and Muslim groups during religious processions and subsequent demolitions of a number of properties mostly belonging to Muslims by authorities.
kin: Mu kwezi gushize imyumvire yo kurwanya abayisilamu n'ibitero byagaragaye hirya no hino mu gihugu, harimo gutera amabuye hagati y'amatsinda y'abahindu n'abayisilamu mu gihe cy'imyigaragambyo y'idini ndetse no gusenya imitungo myinshi ahanini yari iy'abayisilamu n'abayobozi.
mt0: Iyo umuntu atamenya icyo avuga, ntabwo ari igitekerezo cy'umuntu ufite icyo avuga, ndetse n'ibitero byagiye bigaragara mu Rwanda mu mpera z'ukwezi gushize, nk'uko abantu benshi bakoresheje imikogote mu ndwi ishize, nk'uko abantu benshi bakoresheje imikogote mu ndwi ishize.

en: The community, which makes up 14% of Indias 1.4 billion population, is reeling from vilification by hard-line Hindu nationalists who have long espoused an anti-Muslim stance. Some leaders of Indias ruling Hindu nationalist Bharatiya Janata Party have tacitly supported the violence, while Prime Minister Narendra Modi has so far been silent about it. Eid al-Fitr is typically marked with communal prayers, celebratory gatherings around festive meals and new clothes, but celebrations in India for the past two years have been marred by COVID-19 restrictions.
kin: Uyu muryango ugizwe na 14% by'abaturage ba Indias miliyari 1.4, bahangayikishijwe no gutukwa n’abenegihugu b’Abahindu bakomeye kuva kera bashyigikiye imyigaragambyo yo kurwanya Abayisilamu. Bamwe mu bayobozi b’ishyaka riri ku butegetsi ry’Abahindu baharanira inyungu z’Abahindu bashyigikiye byimazeyo ihohoterwa, mu gihe Minisitiri w’intebe Narendra Modi kugeza ubu acecetse. Ubusanzwe Eid al-Fitr irangwa n'amasengesho rusange, guterana kwizihiza amafunguro y'iminsi mikuru hamwe n'imyenda mishya, ariko ibirori mu Buhinde mu myaka ibiri ishize byarangijwe na COVID-19.

en: In Indian-controlled Kashmir, the Muslim festival has been subdued for the past three years because of an unprecedented military lockdown after India stripped the regions semi-autonomy in 2019, followed by the pandemic. The region also saw a rise in violence during Ramadan, with at least 20 militants, two civilians and five police and soldiers killed.
kin: Mu mujyi wa Kashmir ugenzurwa n’Ubuhinde, iserukiramuco ry’abayisilamu rimaze imyaka itatu ryigaruriwe n’igitero kitigeze kibaho nyuma y’uko Ubuhinde bwambuye uturere igice cyigenga muri 2019, hagakurikiraho icyorezo. Muri ako karere kandi hagaragaye urugomo muri Ramazani, hapfa nibura abarwanyi 20, abasivili babiri n'abapolisi n'abasirikare batanu.
mt0: In Kashmir y’Ubuhinde, umunsi w’Imana wa Ramadan uherutse gusubizwa mu buryo butagira imiterere nyuma y’uko igihugu cya India cyakuyeho igice cy’ubutaka bwo mu ntara muri 2019 nyuma y’uko igihugu cyashyizeho igice cy’ubutaka bwo mu ntara muri 2019.

en: "As we prepare to celebrate Eid, a strong sense of collective loss jars at us," said Bashir Ahmed, a businessman in Srinagar.

en: Kashmir is the Muslim-majority disputed region where a violent insurgency against Indian rule and New Delhis brutal crackdown has raged for over three decades. Tens of thousands of people have died in the conflict.
kin: Kashmir ni agace kagizwe n’abayisilamu aho usanga inyeshyamba zikaze ku butegetsi bw’Ubuhinde ndetse n’igitero simusiga cya New Delhis kimaze imyaka isaga mirongo itatu. Abantu ibihumbi mirongo bapfiriye muri iyo ntambara.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura icyo uvuga gusa uvuga ko Kashmir ari igice cy’abategetsi b’Abamusilamu cy’abategetsi bafite uruhare mu ntwaro y’Ubuhinde n’igitero cy’i New Delhi cy’ibyo kurwanya igihugu cy’Ubuhinde cyamaze imyaka itatu.

en: Meanwhile in the capital, New Delhi, hundreds assembled in the Jama Masjid, one of Indias largest mosques, while offering Eid prayers there for the first time in over two years due to pandemic restrictions. Families came together early on Tuesday morning while many people shared hugs and wishes.
kin: Hagati aho, mu murwa mukuru, New Delhi, abantu babarirwa mu magana bateraniye i Jama Masjid, umwe mu misigiti minini ya Indias, mu gihe basengaga umunsi mukuru wa Noheri ku nshuro yabo ya mbere mu myaka irenga ibiri kubera inzitizi z’ibyorezo. Imiryango yateraniye kare mugitondo cyo kuwa kabiri mugihe abantu benshi basangiye guhobera no kwifuriza.
mt0: In New Delhi, hundreds of people gathered in Jama Masjid, one of India's largest mosques, while offering Eid prayers there for the first time in over two years due to pandemic restrictions. Families came together early on Tuesday morning while many people shared hugs and wishes.

en: Beijing Residents Brace for COVID-19 Lockdown
kin: Abatuye Beijing bitegura Gumamurugo kubera COVID-19
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga ko utabizi.

en: Unlike Shanghai, Beijing has yet to require that all its residents remain at home to contain the spread of COVID-19. Nevertheless, many people in its Chaoyang district and elsewhere are preparing for that possibility.
kin: Bitandukanye na Shanghai, Beijing ntisaba ko abaturage bayo bose baguma mu rugo kugira ngo birinde COVID-19. Nubwo bimeze bityo ariko, abantu benshi mu karere kayo ka Chaoyang n'ahandi barimo kwitegura ku buryo bushoboka.
mt0: Iyo ufite icyo uvuga, nk’uko Shanghai, Beijing ntabwo itegeka ko abaturage bose baguma mu rugo kugira ngo ntibagire icyo bavugaga. N’ubwo abantu benshi mu ntara ya Chaoyang n’ahandi bafite ibyo bavugaga.

en: On Wednesday, city officials closed 60 subway stations, more than 10% of Beijing's vast system. They did not say when service would be resumed, according to ABC News.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, abayobozi b'umugi bafunze gari ya moshi 60, zirenga 10% bya sisitemu ngari ya Beijing. Ntibavuze igihe serivisi izasubukurirwa nk'uko ABC News ibitangaza.
mt0: Iyo udashobora gukora icyo ushaka, uvuga ko ufite icyo ushaka. Ku wa Kabiri, abayobozi ba Beijing batanguye gufunga imihanda 60, igera kuri 10% y’ibyo umuntu ashobora gukoresha. Ntiyigeze atangaza igihe imihanda izasubira gukora, nk’uko bitangazwa na ABC News.

en: Beijing, a city of 21 million people, has been on high alert for the spread of COVID-19, as restaurants and bars pivot to takeout, gyms close and schools suspend classes indefinitely, according to CNBC.
kin: Nk’uko CNBC ibitangaza, umujyi wa Beijing, umujyi utuwe na miliyoni 21, wakomeje kuba maso kugira ngo COVID-19 ikwirakwizwe, kubera ko amaresitora n'utubari bikurwaho, siporo zirafunga ndetse n'amashuri ahagarika amasomo mu gihe kitazwi.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: People who live in "controlled" areas, neighborhoods where cases have been discovered, have been told to stay in the city, and all residents must test for the virus three times throughout the week, according to ABC.
kin: Nk’uko ABC ibitangaza, abantu baba mu duce "tugenzurwa", mu duce twagaragayemo ibibazo, basabwe kuguma mu mujyi, kandi abaturage bose bagomba kwipimisha virusi mu cyumweru cyose.
mt0: Iyo umuntu ari mu "bibanza bya mbere" byagaragaye, ahantu hagaragaye abantu bagerageza gukora icyo aricyo cyose, ategekwa guguma mu mujyi, kandi bose bagomba gukora icyo aricyo cyose icyo aricyo cyose mu cyumweru, nk’uko ABC yabitangaje.

en: Chinese authorities reported 5,489 cases nationwide on Wednesday, of which 4,982 were in Shanghai, which has been under a draconian lockdown for weeks.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, abategetsi b'Abashinwa bavuze ko abantu 5489 mu gihugu hose, muri bo 4982 bari i Shanghai, bamaze ibyumweru byinshi bifunzwe.
mt0: Igihugu cy’Ubushinwa cyatangaje ko hagaragaye abantu 5,489 bose bose mu Rwanda, ndetse n’abantu 4,982 bavuye muri Shanghai, igihugu cy’Ubushinwa cyamaze igihe cy’ubukungu bwo kwirinda abantu.

en: Beijing reported 46 symptomatic cases and five asymptomatic on Wednesday. The city's total since April 22, what it considers the start of its omicron outbreak, is 544.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, Pekin yatangaje ibibazo 46 by'ibimenyetso na bitanu bidafite ibimenyetso. Umujyi wose kuva 22 Mata, icyo ubona ko ari intangiriro yicyorezo cyawo, ni 544.
mt0: If you can't translate it simply say you don't know. Beijing reported 46 symptomatic cases and five asymptomatic on Wednesday. The city's total since April 22, what it considers the start of its omicron outbreak, is 544.

en: Mr. Zhang, a Beijing resident, said he had bought extra food and water, even though he doesn't think Beijing will be locked down like Shanghai. He asked that VOA not use his full name because he was afraid of attracting official attention.
kin: Bwana Zhang utuye i Beijing, yavuze ko yaguze ibiryo n'amazi by'inyongera, nubwo adatekereza ko Beijing izafungwa nka Shanghai. Yasabye ko VOA idakoresha izina rye ryuzuye kuko yatinyaga gukurura abayobozi.
mt0: Mr. Zhang, a Beijing resident, said he had bought extra food and water, even though he doesn't think Beijing will be locked down like Shanghai. He asked VOA not to use his full name because he was afraid of attracting official attention.

en: "I have six bags of rice, two bags of noodles, and several boxes of water, instant noodles and (nutritionally dense) biscuits, and I haven't stocked up too much," Zhang told VOA Mandarin in a phone interview last week. He said he bought his groceries online because the supermarket was crowded.

en: Ms. Yao, who lives in the Chaoyang district, told VOA Mandarin that she had been stocking up on necessities since the beginning of this year, after the Ministry of Commerce recommended that everyone do so. She asked that VOA Mandarin not use her full name because she wanted to avoid official retribution.
kin: Madamu Yao utuye mu karere ka Chaoyang, yatangarije VOA Mandarin ko yabitse ibikenerwa kuva mu ntangiriro z'uyu mwaka, nyuma y'uko Minisiteri y'Ubucuruzi ibasabye ko buri wese yabikora. Yasabye ko VOA Mandarin idakoresha izina rye ryuzuye kuko yashakaga kwirinda ibihano byemewe.
mt0: Ms. Yao, ufite umuryango uri mu karere ka Chaoyang, yabwiye VOA Mandarin ko yagiye igura ibintu byose kuva mu ntangiriro z'uyu mwaka, nyuma y'uko minisitiri w'ubucuruzi yatanze inama y'uko buri wese agomba gukora ibyo byose. Yatanze inama y'uko VOA Mandarin ntakoreshe izina rye ryose kugira ngo ntabwo igaragazwa n'abashinzwe ibikorwa by'ubutegetsi.

en: "I have always maintained a good habit of reserving food. So I have a lot of rice, noodles and oil at home," she said, adding that she figured her family would be fine even if Beijing locked down for a month.
kin: Ati: "Nahoraga ngira akamenyero keza ko kubika ibiryo. Mfite rero umuceri, isafuriya n'amavuta mu rugo", akomeza avuga ko yasanze umuryango we uzaba mwiza nubwo Beijing yafunzwe ukwezi.
mt0: Iyo ntashoboye gukora icyo umuntu ashaka, ntabwo ari igikorwa cyiza cyo gufata ibyo ashaka. Njye nfite ibiryo byinshi, noodles, n'amavuta, n'ibindi byose nfite mu rugo," yagize ati: "Ntabwo nshaka gukora icyo umuntu ashaka, nubwo nkunda gufata ibyo ashaka."

en: And while Beijing has not yet closed the city, citizens' lives have been disrupted.
kin: Mu gihe kandi Beijing itarafunga umujyi, ubuzima bw’abaturage bwahurangabanye.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura icyo uvuga, uvuga ko udashobora guhindura icyo uvuga, uvuga ko udashobora guhindura icyo uvuga.

en: On April 28, the Beijing Chaoyang District Maternal and Child Health Care Hospital issued a notice that the outpatient and emergency departments of the hospital would suspend the admission of patients.

en: "Why do you stop the emergency room as soon as there is a new COVID case, and how many people will be killed due to the secondary disaster caused by the COVID?" a netizen asked in a Weibo post.
kin: "Kuki uhagarika icyumba cyihutirwa ukimara kubona ikibazo gishya cya COVID, kandi ni bangahe bazahitanwa n’impanuka ya kabiri yatewe na COVID?" umu netisen yabajije mu nyandiko ya Weibo.

en: Some Beijing residents said they were not worried about a Shanghai-like lockdown.
kin: Bamwe mu baturage ba Beijing bavuze ko badahangayikishijwe no gufunga nka Shanghai.
mt0: Reka gusa uvuga ko abantu bamwe bavuga ko batatinya icyo kizabera i Shanghai.

en: "Basically, I'm not afraid," said Mr. Wang, who asked VOA Mandarin to not use his full name so he could avoid attracting authorities' attention. "The party, government and military are here, and the people are here."
kin: Bwana Wang wasabye VOA Mandarin kudakoresha izina rye ryuzuye kugira ngo yirinde gukurura abayobozi. Ati: "Muri rusange, ntabwo ntinya." Ishyaka, guverinoma n'abasirikare bari hano, kandi abaturage bari hano.
mt0: "Ntabwo ntinya," nk'uko Wang yabwiye VOA Mandarin, n'aho yatanze icyemezo ko ntabwo ashyira imbere izina rye ryose kugira ngo ntashobore gukora iperereza. "Icyo gihugu, igihugu n'igipolisi ari hano, kandi abantu bose ari hano."

en: However, Wang told VOA Mandarin, in mid-October last year, after one person in his apartment building was diagnosed as positive, about 600 people from more than 200 families were forced into isolation at several hotels in the Changping district for 21 days.
kin: Icyakora, Wang yabwiye VOA Mandarin, ko hagati mu Kwakira umwaka ushize, nyuma yuko basanze umuntu umwe mu nyubako ye afite icyiza, abantu bagera kuri 600 bo mu miryango irenga 200 bahatiwe kwigunga mu mahoteri menshi yo mu karere ka Changping mu gihe cy'iminsi 21.
mt0: However, Wang told VOA Mandarin, in mid-October last year, after one person in his apartment building was diagnosed as positive, about 600 people from more than 200 families were forced into isolation at several hotels in Changping district for 21 days.

en: Wang and his wife were not allowed to share a room at their hotel.

en: At US Urging, Fiji Seizes Russian Oligarch’s Yacht
kin: Muri Amerika babisabye, Fiji Yafashe Yacht ya Oligarch yo mu Burusiya.
mt0: Ubwo Amerika ivuga ko igomba gukora icyo ivuga, Fiji yagize icyo ivuga inyuma y’uko u Rwanda rwafashe ubwato bw’umunyarusiya ufite umutungo n’umugabo.

en: Another Russian oligarchs yacht was seized Thursday as part of efforts to punish Russia over its war in Ukraine.
kin: Indi yacht yo mu Burusiya yafashwe mu rwego rwo guhana Uburusiya kubera intambara yabereye muri Ukraine.
mt0: Again, another Russian oligarchs yacht was seized Thursday as part of efforts to punish Russia over its war in Ukraine.

en: At the request of the United States, Fijian officials took a $300 million yacht belonging to Suleiman Kerimov, the Justice Department said. Officials say the yacht is in Lautoka, Fiji.

en: Kerimovs yacht, the Cayman Island-flagged Amadea, reportedly has been in Fiji since last month, arriving from Mexico. Defense lawyers claimed the vessel belonged to another oligarch.
kin: Yacht Kerimovs, ikirwa cya Cayman Flagged Amadea, bivugwa ko ari muri Fiji kuva mu kwezi gushize, ageze muri Mexico. Abunganira abaregwa bavuze ko ubwo bwato ari ubwa oligarch.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know Kerimov's yacht, the Cayman Islands-flagged Amadea, reportedly has been in Fiji since last month, arriving from Mexico. Defense lawyers claimed the vessel belonged to another oligarch.

en: Kerimov had already been sanctioned by the U.S. in 2014 and 2018 for Russias activities in Syria and Ukraine. The European Union also sanctioned him.
kin: Kerimov yari amaze kwemererwa na Amerika muri 2014 na 2018 kubera ibikorwa by'Uburusiya muri Siriya na Ukraine. Umuryango w’ubumwe bw’ibihugu by’i Burayi na we wamwemereye.
mt0: Kerimov yamaze gufatwa n'Amerika mu 2014 na 2018 kubera ibikorwa bya Russia muri Syria na Ukraine. U.K. nabwo yafatwa n'U.U.

en: In March, the U.S. government announced a comprehensive effort to identify and seize the assets of wealthy Russians who have supported the government of Russian President Vladmir Putin, as part of the response to Moscows February 24 invasion of Ukraine.
kin: Muri Werurwe, guverinoma y’Amerika yatangaje ko hashyizweho ingufu mu kumenya no gufata umutungo w’Abarusiya bakize bashyigikiye guverinoma ya Perezida w’Uburusiya Vladmir Putin, mu rwego rwo gusubiza i Moscou igitero cyo ku ya 24 Gashyantare.
mt0: In March, the U.S. government announced a comprehensive effort to identify and seize the assets of wealthy Russians who have supported the government of Russian President Vladmir Putin, as part of the response to Moscow's February 24 invasion of Ukraine.

en: The initiative, led by the Justice Department, is called Task Force KleptoCapture.
kin: Iyi gahunda iyobowe n’ishami ry’ubutabera, yitwa Task Force KleptoCapture.
mt0: Return only if you can't translate. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: U.S. Attorney General Merrick Garland said Thursday in a statement there is "no hiding place for the assets of criminals who enable the Russian regime." He also said, "The Justice Department will be relentless in our efforts to hold accountable those who facilitate the death and destruction we are witnessing in Ukraine."

en: In April, at the urging of the U.S., Spanish authorities seized a yacht belonging to Russian oligarch Viktor Vekselberg, the owner of the Russian conglomerate Renova Group.
kin: Muri Mata, abisabwe na Amerika, abategetsi ba Espagne bafashe ubwato bwa oligarch yo mu Burusiya Viktor Vekselberg, nyiri itsinda ry’Abarusiya Renova Group.
mt0: In April, amakuru y’Amerika yatangaje ko igihugu cy’Ubupaniyani cyohereje igihugu cy’Ubuspanyoli kugira ngo cyohereze ubwato bw’umunyarusiya Viktor Vekselberg, umuyobozi w’ishirahamwe Renova Group.

en: Last week, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a measure that would allow the U.S. government to sell forfeited Russian properties worth more than $2 million for the benefit of Ukraine. The measures next step is the Senate.
kin: Mu cyumweru gishize, Inteko ishinga amategeko y’Amerika yemeje ingamba zemerera guverinoma y’Amerika kugurisha imitungo y’Uburusiya yatakaye ifite agaciro ka miliyoni zirenga 2 z’inyungu za Ukraine. Ingamba zikurikira ni Sena.
mt0: Last week, the U.S. House of Representatives passed a measure that would allow the U.S. government to sell forfeited Russian properties worth more than $2 million for the benefit of Ukraine. The measures next step is the Senate.

en: WHO Report Says COVID Cases Decline, Except in Americas, Africa

en: In its weekly report on the pandemic, the U.N. health agency said there were about 3.8 million new infections and more than 15,000 deaths last week, a 17% and 3% drop on the week respectively. But those figures are believed to be a significant underestimate of COVID-19's true toll as increasing numbers of countries abandon widespread testing and surveillance.
kin: Muri raporo y’icyumweru ivuga ku cyorezo, ikigo cy’ubuzima cya Leta zunze ubumwe z’Amerika cyavuze ko mu cyumweru gishize hari abantu bashya bagera kuri miliyoni 3.8 n’impfu zirenga 15.000, icyumweru 17% na 3% bikagabanuka. Ariko iyo mibare ngo ni ugusuzugura cyane umubare wa COVID-19 kuko umubare w’ibihugu ugenda ureka kwipimisha no kugenzura.
mt0: In its weekly report on the pandemic, the U.N. health agency said there were about 3.8 million new infections and more than 15,000 deaths last week, a 17% and 3% drop on the week respectively. But those figures are believed to be a significant underestimate of COVID-19's true toll as increasing numbers of countries abandon widespread testing and surveillance.

en: Still, WHO noted that cases rose by about a third in Africa and 13% in the Americas. There was also a nearly 70% jump in deaths reported in India, although that was attributed to delayed reporting rather than a recent surge of disease.
kin: Ninde, OMS yavuze ko imanza ziyongereyeho kimwe cya gatatu muri Afurika na 13% muri Amerika. Habayeho kandi gusimbuka hafi 70% by'impfu zavuzwe mu Buhinde, nubwo ibyo byatewe no gutinda gutanga raporo aho kuba indwara ziherutse kwiyongera.
mt0: Icyakora, WHO yatanze amakuru ko abantu bagera kuri 3% muri Afrika na 13% muri Amerika. Hari kandi ubwa 70% bwo kugera kuri 70% mu Rwanda, ariko ibyo byagaragajwe nk’uko byagaragajwe n’uko abantu bagera kuri 70% bapfuye n’uko abantu bagera kuri 70% bapfuye.

en: Last week, authorities in South Africa said they had noted an uptick in COVID-19 cases attributable to the BA.4 mutant of omicron, although they said it was too early to tell if that would result in a significant new wave of disease. Although the BA.4 version of COVID-19's omicron variant appears more infectious than omicron, WHO said there was no evidence yet that it was leading to substantially higher rates of hospitalization or death.
kin: Mu cyumweru gishize, abategetsi bo muri Afurika yepfo bavuze ko babonye ikibazo cya COVID-19 cyatewe na BA.4 mutant ya omicron, nubwo bavuze ko hakiri kare kumenya niba ibyo byavamo indwara nshya. Nubwo verisiyo ya BA.4 ya COVID-19 ya omicron isa nkaho yanduye kurusha omicron, OMS yavuze ko nta kimenyetso cyerekana ko biganisha ku mubare munini w’ibitaro cyangwa urupfu.

en: Salim Abdool Karim, a public health expert at the University of KwaZulu-Natal, said that while only a "modest" rise in cases had been noted, South Africa was also in the middle of a holiday period and testing had dropped significantly. He said the cases were slowing and were "not following a rocket-like upward trajectory we would expect" in another spike of disease.

en: Meanwhile in China, authorities continued to crack down on cities, including Beijing, where more than 10% of the subway system was shut down in an effort to curb the virus' spread, after authorities in the capital already closed down indoor dining, gyms and school classes.

en: In Shanghai, rigid and widely derided restrictions have led to shortages of food and medical aid along with a wider — though likely temporary — impact on the national economy. Desperate, outraged citizens have confronted authorities at barricades and online, screamed out of their windows and banged pots and pans in a sign of frustration and anger.
kin: Muri Shanghai, imbogamizi zikomeye kandi zisebya abantu benshi zatumye ibura ry'ibiribwa n'inkunga z'ubuvuzi hamwe n’ingaruka nini nubwo zishobora kuba iz'igihe gito - ku bukungu bw'igihugu. Abaturage bihebye, bararakaye bahanganye n'abayobozi kuri bariyeri no kuri interineti, bavuza induru bava mu madirishya maze bakubita inkono n'amasafuriya mu rwego rwo kwiheba n'uburakari.

en: Myanmar Supreme Court Rejects Aung San Suu Kyi Appeal on Corruption Charges
kin: Urukiko rw'Ikirenga rwa Miyanimari rwanze ubujurire bwa Aung San Suu Kyi ku byaha aregwa bya ruswa
mt0: Myanmar Supreme Court Rejects Aung San Suu Kyi Appeal on Corruption Charges . If you cannot translate simply say you don't know .

en: An appeal of a five-year jail sentence against ousted Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi was rejected Wednesday by the country's supreme court.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, urukiko rw’ikirenga rw’igihugu rwanze ubujurire bw’igifungo cy’imyaka 5 ku muyobozi wa Miyanimari wirukanwe Aung San Suu Kyi.
mt0: Appeal of a five-year jail sentence against ousted Myanmar leader Aung San Suu Kyi was rejected Wednesday by the country's supreme court.

en: The decision reportedly came as soon as the claim for an appeal was lodged, and the court didn't entertain arguments from either side in the case.
kin: Iki cyemezo ngo cyafashwe akimara gutanga ikirego mu bujurire, kandi urukiko ntirwakiriye impaka ku mpande zombi muri uru rubanza.
mt0: Iyo nshingano yavuzwe ko yagaragaye nyuma y'uko igitekerezo cyo gusubira inyuma cy'ubujurire bwashyizweho, kandi urukiko ntirufite icyo ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari ryari

en: Suu Kyi, 76, was sentenced last week after being found guilty of 11 counts of corruption, including taking a bribe of cash and gold bars worth $600,000.
kin: Mu cyumweru gishize, Suu Kyi, yakatiwe nyuma yo guhamwa n'ibyaha 11 bya ruswa, birimo gufata ruswa y'amafaranga n'utubari twa zahabu bifite agaciro ka $ 600,000.
mt0: Iyo umuntu ufite imyaka 76 yaremewe n'amategeko nyuma yuko ahamishwa n'ibibazo 11 by'ubucuruzi, nk'uko yafashwe n'abafatanyije n'ubutunzi n'amafaranga y'amadolari $600,000.

en: Her lawyer called the charge absurd.
kin: Umwunganizi we yavuze ko ikirego kitumvikana.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga ko ntabwo uzi.

en: Suu Kyi had already been sentenced to six years for actions against the military, breaking COVID-19 rules and breaking a telecommunications law.
kin: Suu Kyi yari amaze gukatirwa imyaka itandatu kubera ibikorwa byo kurwanya igisirikare, kurenga ku mategeko ya COVID-19 no kurenga ku itegeko ry'itumanaho.
mt0: Reka rero uvuga ko Suu Kyi yamaze gufungwa imyaka itanu kubera ibikorwa bya nyuma bya umuntu urimo n'igipolisi, ibihano bya COVID-19 n'ibihano bya teliya.

en: She faces many more charges, and if found guilty could be sentenced to more than 150 years in jail.
kin: Akurikiranyweho ibindi byaha byinshi, kandi aramutse ahamwe n'icyaha ashobora gukatirwa imyaka irenga 150.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga ko ntabwo uzi.

en: Suu Kyi has been under house arrest since a military coup took over the country last year.
kin: Suu Kyi afungiye mu rugo kuva ihirikwa ry’abasirikare ryigarurira igihugu umwaka ushize.
mt0: Return only if you can't translate. Suu Kyi has been under house arrest since a military coup took over the country last year.

en: Since the coup, on Feb. 1, 2021, there have been widespread protests against the military regime. The regime cracked down violently in many cases, leaving more than 1,800 civilians dead and more than 10,000 arrested, charged or sentenced, according to the Assistance Association for Political Prisoners (Burma).
kin: Kuva ihirikwa ry’ubutegetsi, ku ya 1 Gashyantare 2021, habaye imyigaragambyo yo kwamagana ubutegetsi bwa gisirikare. Ishyirahamwe rifasha imfungwa za politiki (Birimaniya) rivuga ko ubwo butegetsi bwahagurukiye mu buryo bwinshi, hasigara abasivili barenga 1.800 abandi barenga 10,000 batawe muri yombi, bakurikiranyweho cyangwa bakatirwa.
mt0: Since the coup, on Feb. 1, 2021, there have been widespread protests against the military regime. The regime cracked down violently in many cases, leaving more than 1,800 civilians dead and more than 10,000 arrested, charged or sentenced, according to the Assistance Association for Political Prisoners (Burma).

en: The country had reopened for tourists from Australia weeks ago, but the new relaxation of restrictions now allows tourists from over 60 countries to visit, including most European countries and the U.S.

en: Irans semiofficial ISNA news agency on Wednesday released a report in which Iranian officials stated that Tehran will implement the death penalty against Ahmad Reza Jalali by May 21.
kin: Kuri uyu wa gatatu, ibiro ntaramakuru ISNA bitanga amakuru kuri Irans byatangaje raporo aho abayobozi ba Irani bavuze ko Tehran izashyira mu bikorwa igihano cy'urupfu kuri Ahmad Reza Jalali bitarenze ku ya 21 Gicurasi.
mt0: ISNA agency released a report on Wednesday in which Iran officials stated that Tehran will implement the death penalty against Ahmad Reza Jalali by May 21.

en: Jalali, a researcher and physician who specializes in disaster relief, was arrested during a visit to Iran in April 2016. In 2017, Jalali was sentenced to death in Iran after he had been found guilty of passing information about two Iranian nuclear scientists to Israel to help it assassinate several nuclear scientists.
kin: Jalali, umushakashatsi n’umuganga w’inzobere mu gutabara ibiza, yatawe muri yombi ubwo yari mu ruzinduko muri Irani muri Mata 2016. Muri 2017, Jalali yakatiwe urwo gupfa muri Irani nyuma yo guhamwa n’icyaha cyo kugeza amakuru kuri siyansi ebyiri za Irani muri Isiraheli fasha guhitana abahanga benshi ba kirimbuzi.
