en: The announcement came as authorities in Stockholm wrapped up the trial of Hamid Nouri, a former Iranian prosecution official whom Swedish officials arrested in November 2019.
kin: Ibi byatangajwe mu gihe abayobozi i Stockholm bashoje urubanza rwa Hamid Nouri wahoze ari umushinjacyaha wa Irani, abayobozi ba Suwede bata muri yombi mu Gushyingo 2019.
mt0: Iyi itangazo yabaye nyuma yuko abashinzwe iperereza muri Stockholm barangije urubanza rw’umugabo w’umucamanza Hamid Nouri, umushoferi w’ubutungane w’Uburayi uheruka gufatwa muri Swedish authorities muri Nzeri 2019.

en: Authorities say Nouri played a role in the deaths of political prisoners executed on Iranian government orders at Irans Gohardasht prison during the final phase of the Iran-Iraq war in 1988. Nouri has been held in custody in Sweden since his arrest.
kin: Abayobozi bavuga ko Nouri yagize uruhare mu rupfu rw’imfungwa za politiki ziciwe ku itegeko rya guverinoma ya Irani muri gereza ya Irans Gohardasht mu cyiciro cya nyuma cy’intambara ya Irani na Iraki mu 1988. Nouri afungiye muri Suwede kuva yatabwa muri yombi.
mt0: Authorities say Nouri played a role in the deaths of political prisoners executed on Iranian government orders at Iran's Gohardasht prison during the final phase of the Iran-Iraq war in 1988. Nouri has been held in custody in Sweden since his arrest.

en: On Wednesday, the final day of Nouri's trial, a Stockholm district court judge set the date of the verdict for July 14.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, umunsi wa nyuma w’urubanza rwa Nouri, umucamanza w’urukiko rw’intara ya Stockholm yashyizeho itariki y’urubanza ku ya 14 Nyakanga.
mt0: Igihe cy'umunsi wanyuma wa Nouri's trial, umushaki w'ubutungane wa Stockholm yashyizeho tariki 14 Nyakanga.

en: Amnesty International put the number of those executed at the prison at 5,000 but said in a 2018 report that the number could be higher.
kin: Amnesty International yashyize ahagaragara umubare w'abiciwe muri gereza ku 5.000 ariko muri raporo ya 2018 ivuga ko umubare ushobora kuba mwinshi.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga uti ntabwo muzi. Amnesty International yashyize igice cy’abantu bose bapfiriye muri gereza y’i Rwanda kuri 5,000 ariko yavuze mu raporo ya 2018 ko igice gishobora kuba cyiyongereye.

en: Human Rights Watch, in a recent report, said, "Iran continues to be one of the worlds leading implementers of the death penalty."
kin: Human Rights Watch, muri raporo iherutse, yagize ati: "Irani ikomeje kuba umwe mu isi iyobora abashyira mu bikorwa igihano cy'urupfu."
mt0: Icyo gihugu cy’Ubushinwa cy’uburenganzira bw’abantu, mu raporo y’ibyo nyuma, yavuze ati: "Iran iracyari umwe mu bayobozi b’ibihano by’urupfu mu nsi y’isi."

en: If Nouri is convicted, he will face a maximum life sentence on charges of international war crimes and human rights abuses. Iran recently summoned the Swedish envoy in protest over Nouris case.
kin: Nouri aramutse ahamwe n'icyaha, azahanishwa igifungo cya burundu ashinjwa ibyaha mpuzamahanga by'intambara no guhonyora uburenganzira bwa muntu. Irani iherutse guhamagara intumwa ya Suwede mu rwego rwo kwamagana ikibazo cya Nouris.
mt0: If Nouri is convicted, he will face a maximum life sentence on charges of international war crimes and human rights abuses. Iran recently summoned the Swedish envoy in protest over Nouris case.

en: Maja Aberg, senior policy adviser with Amnesty International Sweden, says it is no coincidence that Iran announced Jalalis pending execution just after Swedish prosecutors moved on Nouris trial.
kin: Maja Aberg, umujyanama mukuru muri politiki muri Amnesty International Suwede, avuga ko bidahwitse ko Irani yatangaje Jalalis mu gihe hagitegerejwe kwicwa nyuma yuko abashinjacyaha ba Suwede bimukiye mu rubanza rwa Nouris.
mt0: Maja Aberg, umuyobozi mukuru w’ubufatanye n’Amnesty International Sweden, says it is no coincidence that Iran announced Jalalis pending execution just after Swedish prosecutors moved on Nouris trial.

en: "It indicates that (Iran) sees him as a kind of piece in the jigsaw puzzle, which is very worrying," Aberg told Sweden's TT news agency.
kin: Aberg yatangarije ibiro ntaramakuru TT byo muri Suwede ati: "Byerekana ko (Irani) imubona nk'igice cyo mu gihirahiro, biteye impungenge cyane."
mt0: Iyo umuntu atamenya icyo ari cyo, ntabwo ari igitekerezo cyiza.

en: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan heads to Saudi Arabia Thursday for a two-day visit aimed at easing old tensions between Ankara and Riyadh.
kin: Ku wa kane, Perezida wa Turkiya, Recep Tayyip Erdogan yerekeje muri Arabiya Sawudite mu ruzinduko rw’iminsi ibiri rugamije kugabanya amakimbirane ashaje hagati ya Ankara na Riyadh.
mt0: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan heads to Saudi Arabia Thursday for a two-day visit aimed at easing old tensions between Ankara and Riyadh.

en: The Turkish leaders visit with the Saudi king comes after years of rivalry between their once-close countries.
kin: Abayobozi ba Turukiya basuye n’umwami wa Arabiya Sawudite bije nyuma y’imyaka myinshi bahanganye hagati y’ibihugu byabo byahoze.
mt0: Return only if you can't translate. If you can't translate simply say you don't know

en: Mehmet Ogutcu is the head of the London Energy Club, a grouping of government and energy sector leaders. Ogutcu says the visit is the culmination of intense international diplomacy.
kin: Mehmet Ogutcu ni umuyobozi wa Club y’ingufu za Londres, itsinda ry’abayobozi ba guverinoma n’ingufu. Ogutcu avuga ko uruzinduko ari indunduro ya diplomasi mpuzamahanga.
mt0: Mehmet Ogutcu ni umuyobozi wa London Energy Club, ashyirahamwe ry’abakuru b’igihugu n’abakuru b’ubucuruzi. Ogutcu says the visit is the culmination of intense international diplomacy.

en: "President Erdogan has good relations with the king; with the crown prince Muhammad Bin Salman, we had serious difficulties," said Ogutcu. "Now it looks that I believe the*(Britons), and Americans, and the Qataris of course played some role, even the Azeris might have done this. And things are changing and relaxing a bit more, and now at the presidential level, it's going to be sealed."
kin: Ogutcu ati: "Perezida Erdogan afitanye umubano mwiza n'umwami; n'umutware w'ikamba Muhammad Bin Salman, twagize ibibazo bikomeye". "Noneho birasa nkaho nizera * (Abongereza), n'Abanyamerika, ndetse na Qatar birumvikana ko hari uruhare bagize, ndetse n'abanya Azerisitani bashobora kuba barabikoze. en: Erdogan and the crown prince have been bitter rivals. The Turkish president led international condemnation over the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, who was killed inside Saudi Arabias consulate in Istanbul.
kin: Erdogan n'umutware w'ikamba babaye abanywanyi bakaze. Perezida wa Turkiya yamaganye amahanga kubera iyicwa ry'umunyamakuru wa Arabiya Sawudite, Jamal Khashoggi, yiciwe muri konsuline ya Arabiya Sawudite i Istanbul.
mt0: Erdogan na crown prince bose ntibumvikana. Erdogan yatanze icyo ati: "Ntabwo muzi ko Erdogan na crown prince bose ntibumvikana.

en: The killing was linked to the crown prince, a charge he denied. But the decision earlier this month to move the Khashoggi murder trial from Istanbul to Riyadh is seen as a gesture by Ankara, opening the way for Erdogan's visit.

en: Ogutcu says with presidential elections due next year, Erdogan is looking for Saudi help to bail out the ailing Turkish economy.
kin: Ogutcu avuga ko hamwe n'amatora ya perezida ateganijwe umwaka utaha, Erdogan arimo gushaka ubufasha bwa Arabiya Sawudite kugira ngo akize ubukungu bwa Turukiya burwaye.
mt0: Ogutcu says with presidential elections due next year, Erdogan is looking for Saudi help to bail out the ailing Turkish economy.

en: "Turkey has an interest in reviving relations with Riyadh because Turkey needs financial support," said Ogutcu. "The Turkish economy is not attracting any significant portfolio investments nor sovereign wealth funds coming to invest Turkey. But this will be a give-and-take package deal involving these countries. So, there are real economic and political security interests involved."
kin: Ogutcu ati: "Turkiya ishishikajwe no kongera umubano na Riyadh kuko Turukiya ikeneye inkunga y'amafaranga". "Ubukungu bwa Turukiya ntabwo bukurura ishoramari rikomeye cyangwa amafaranga y’umutungo wigenga uza gushora Turukiya. Ariko aya azaba amasezerano yo gutanga no gufata ibyemezo birimo ibi bihugu. Ku bw'ibyo, hari inyungu z’ubukungu n’ubukungu bya politiki zirimo."
mt0: "Turkey is interested in reviving relations with Riyadh because Turkey needs financial support," said Ogutcu. "The Turkish economy is not attracting any significant portfolio investments nor sovereign wealth funds coming to invest Turkey. But this will be a give-and-take package deal involving these countries. So, there are real economic and political security interests involved."

en: Shared concerns over Iran's growing influence in the region -- along with its nuclear energy program -- provide important common ground between Riyadh and Ankara, says international relations professor Soli Ozel of Istanbul's Kadir Has University, especially as American attention is expected to pivot away from the Middle East and toward China.
kin: Umwarimu w’umubano mpuzamahanga, Soli Ozel wo muri kaminuza ya Kadir Has ya kaminuza ya Istanbul, avuga ko impungenge z’uko Irani igenda yiyongera muri kariya karere - hamwe na gahunda yayo y’ingufu za kirimbuzi - bitanga icyerekezo rusange hagati ya Riyadh na Ankara. Uburasirazuba bwo hagati no mu Bushinwa.

en: "Turkey does propose itself as a counterweight to Iran. Both countries have an interest along with all the western countries for Iran not to be as influential throughout the region as it is today," said Ozel. "And the Iranians are also constantly sending signals that they are not going to let others draw them away from those countries - Iraq, Lebanon and Syria - where they have quite a lot of influence."
kin: Ozel yagize ati: "Turukiya yiyerekana nk'ikibazo cyo guhangana na Irani. Ibihugu byombi bifite inyungu hamwe n'ibihugu byose byo mu burengerazuba bw'isi kugira ngo Irani itagira uruhare runini mu karere nk'uko bimeze ubu." "Kandi Abanyayirani nabo bahora bohereza ibimenyetso byerekana ko batazemera ko abandi babavana muri ibyo bihugu - Iraki, Libani na Siriya - aho bafite uruhare runini."
mt0: "Turkey ivuga ko igomba kuba igice cy'ubutegetsi bw'Iran. Ibihugu byombi hamwe n'ibihugu byose bya Amerika n'ibindi bihugu bya Buraya bafite inshingano yo guhagarika Irani kugira ngo ntibe nk'uko ari cyo igihugu cy'u Rwanda, Iraq, Lebanon na Syria - ahantu hashobora kubaho ingufu zikomeye."

en: Erdogan's Saudi visit is part of a wider policy of seeking to repair relations across the region in a bid to end its isolation. The Turkish president has recently visited the United Arab Emirates and earlier this month hosted the Israeli president, Isaac Herzog.
kin: Uruzinduko rwa Erdogan muri Arabiya Sawudite ni imwe muri politiki yagutse yo gusana umubano mu karere kose hagamijwe guhagarika akato. Perezida wa Turukiya aherutse gusura Leta zunze ubumwe z'Abarabu kandi mu ntangiriro z'uku kwezi yakiriye perezida wa Isiraheli, Isaac Herzog.
mt0: Erdogan's Saudi visit is part of a wider policy of seeking to repair relations across the region in a bid to end its isolation. The Turkish president has recently visited the United Arab Emirates and earlier this month hosted the Israeli president, Isaac Herzog.

en: But analyst Ozel warns Ankara is in a vulnerable position.
kin: Ariko umusesenguzi Ozel aragabisha Ankara ari mu bihe bigoye.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga ko Ankara iri mu rwego rwo guhungabana.

en: "Turkey alienated, insulted, offended a lot of countries with which it had at least decent relations. And they all recognize that this burst of diplomacy is coming out of weakness rather than strength," said Ozel.
kin: Ozel yagize ati: "Turukiya yitandukanyije, iratukwa, ibabaza ibihugu byinshi byari bifitanye nibura n'imibanire myiza. Kandi bose baremera ko uku guturika kwa diplomasi biva mu ntege nke aho gukomera."
mt0: "Turkey yagize ingaruka mbi, yagize ingaruka mbi, yagize ingaruka mbi ku bihugu byinshi byagiye bifite isano nziza n'igihugu. Abantu bose bamenye ko uru rubuga rw'ubudiplomasi ruturuka mu buryo bwo guhungabana n'ubutwari," yagize ati.

en: But analysts say Ankara is banking on its importance as a potential bulwark to Iranian ambitions, a factor that may help overcome any remaining hostility among the neighbors it is trying to win back.
kin: Ariko abasesenguzi bavuga ko Ankara ari banki ku kamaro kayo nk’igihome gikomeye cyo kwifuza kwa Irani, kikaba ari ikintu gishobora gufasha gutsinda inzangano zisigaye mu baturanyi igerageza gutsinda.
mt0: Icyakora, amakuru y’abanyamakuru avuga ko Ankara ibona ko ari igikorwa cy’ingenzi cyo kuba igice cy’ingenzi cy’ubushake bw’Iran, igikorwa gishobora gufasha gukuraho icyo cy’ubutwari cy’abategetsi bayo.

en: Announced last year by de facto ruler Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, the measures, including the first written penal code, appear to align with Saudi Arabia's goal of opening up to the world and softening its extremist image.
kin: Byatangajwe umwaka ushize n’umutegetsi w’ikirenga, igikomangoma, Mohammed bin Salman, ingamba, harimo n’igitabo cya mbere cy’amategeko ahana, bigaragara ko zihuye n’intego ya Arabiya Sawudite yo gukingura isi no koroshya isura y’intagondwa.
mt0: Iyi nshingano, izwi nka 'first written penal code', igaragaza ko igiye guhura n'ibyo Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman yatangaje mu mwaka ushize, n'icyo ashaka kugeraho cyo kugira ngo igihugu cye gifungure igihugu cye ku isi yose ndetse no gukuraho icyo cyitwa 'extremism'.

en: Even critics concede the changes could make Saudi courts more predictable, in some cases.

en: The second, a family law, is to take effect in June. In a traditionally male-dominated system, it expands the rights of divorced women to alimony and custody of their children.
kin: Iya kabiri, amategeko yumuryango, agomba gukurikizwa muri kamena. Muri gahunda gakondo yiganjemo abagabo, yagura uburenganzira bwabagore bahukanye kubatunga no kurera abana babo.
mt0: Itegeko rya kabiri, ryitwa itegeko ry’umuryango, rizashyira mu bikorwa muri Kamena. Mu buryo bwa kera bwo gushinga abantu, rizakuraho imibereho y’abagore bafite abana bafite abana.

en: Announcing the new law in March, Prince Mohammed said it represented "a major qualitative leap" for women's rights and "family stability."
kin: Mu kwezi kwa Werurwe, igikomangoma Mohammed yatangaje iryo tegeko rishya, yavuze ko rihagarariye "gusimbuka ubuziranenge" ku burenganzira bw'umugore no "gutekana mu muryango."
mt0: Intangiriro z'ukwezi kwa gatatu, ubwo Prince Mohammed yatangaje icyo kibanza, yavuze ko ari "igikorwa cy'ingenzi" ku rwego rw'uburenganzira bw'abagore n'ubuzima bw'umuryango.

en: The reforms seem partly to cater to foreign firms whose investment the kingdom is courting, said Adel al-Saeed, vice president of the European Saudi Organization for Human Rights.
kin: Adel al-Saeed, visi perezida w’umuryango w’ubumwe bw’ibihugu by’Uburayi ushinzwe uburenganzira bwa muntu, Adel al-Saeed yavuze ko iryo vugurura risa nkaho ryita ku masosiyete y’amahanga ashora imari mu bwami.
mt0: If you can't translate the reforms simply say you don't know

en: "The owners of capital are afraid of investing in this country, which is notorious in the legal aspect, so these laws are intended to change the image," he said.
kin: Ati: "Ba nyir'imari bafite ubwoba bwo gushora imari muri iki gihugu, kizwiho amategeko, bityo aya mategeko agamije guhindura isura".
mt0: "Abantu bafite amafaranga batinya gukora imisoro muri iki gihugu, igihugu cy’abatware n’ubutungane, rero izo nshingano zari zikenewe kugira ngo umuntu ahindure icyo ishusho," yagize ati.

en: The new penal code, yet to be unveiled, could bring further dramatic changes.
kin: Igitabo gishya cy'amategeko ahana, kitarashyirwa ahagaragara, gishobora kuzana izindi mpinduka zikomeye.
mt0: Iyo ntabwo uzi icyo uvuga, uravuga uti ntabwo muzi. Itegeko rishya ry’ubutungane, riri gushidikanya, rishobora gushyira mu bikorwa ibindi byinshi by’ingenzi.

en: Under sharia, only apostasy, theft, revolt, armed robbery, adultery, drinking alcohol and slander carry prescribed sentences. Judges are left to determine punishment in other cases.

en: With a penal code in place, "the state will expect judges to rely not on their own training in sharia but instead on the legal rules (based on sharia) approved by the state," said Nathan Brown, an academic at George Washington University.
kin: Hamwe n’amategeko ahana, "leta izateganya ko abacamanza batashingira ku mahugurwa yabo bwite muri shariya ahubwo bakurikiza amategeko (ashingiye kuri shariya) yemejwe na leta", ibi bikaba byavuzwe na Nathan Brown, umunyeshuri muri kaminuza ya George Washington.
mt0: With a penal code in place, "the state will expect judges to rely not on their own training in sharia but instead on the legal rules (based on sharia) approved by the state," said Nathan Brown, a academic at George Washington University.

en: "As a result, Saudi Arabia will look much more like a civil law system, much like most states in the region," said Brown, who has studied the Saudi reforms.
kin: Brown wize ku ivugurura rya Arabiya Sawudite yagize ati: "Kubera iyo mpamvu, Arabiya Sawudite izasa cyane na gahunda y’amategeko mbonezamubano, kimwe na Leta nyinshi zo mu karere."
mt0: "Aso rero, Saudi Arabia izagaragara nkaho igiye gushyiraho uburyo bwo gukora iperereza, nk’uko bimeze mu bihugu byinshi mu karere," nk’uko Brown, ufite ubumenyi bwo muri Arabie Saoudite, yavuze.

en: The result should be more "predictability," said Abdullah Alaoudh, a U.S.-based legal expert and government critic, as new rules "take away from the leeway ... that the judges used to have."
kin: Ibisubizo bigomba kurushaho kuba "guhanura", nk'uko byavuzwe na Abdullah Alaoudh, impuguke mu by'amategeko ukomoka muri Amerika akaba anenga guverinoma, kubera ko amategeko mashya "akuraho inzira ... abacamanza bari bafite."
mt0: Icyo gituma umuntu ashoboye gukora icyo ashaka ni "ubumenyi bwo kwirinda," Abdullah Alaoudh, umuhinga mu bya sheria akaba n'umuhanga w'ubutegetsi uheruka gushyiraho igihugu, yavuze ko itegeko rishya "rikuraho uburyo ... bwo gukora icyo ashaka."

en: But tighter regulation by the monarchy also "creates a larger problem: lack of independence," he added.
kin: Yongeyeho ko ariko gukurikiza amategeko agenga ubwami nabyo "bitera ikibazo kinini: kubura ubwigenge".
mt0: Iyo imiterere y’itegeko ry’ubwami nayo “igaragaza icyo kibazo gikomeye: ntabwo ufite ubutwari.”

en: The king is the head of the Saudi judiciary and acts as the final court of appeal.
kin: Umwami ni umuyobozi wubutabera bwa Arabiya Sawudite kandi akora nkurukiko rwa nyuma rwubujurire.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga uti ntabwo muzi. Umwami ni umushingamateka wa Saudi nshingamateka kandi ashyira imbere igikiko cy’imperuka.

en: Alaoudh's own father, prominent cleric Salman al-Awdah, has been held since 2017, seemingly in retaliation for a Twitter post that clashed with Saudi Arabia's policy at the time of isolating Qatar.
kin: Se wa Alaoudh, umunyamadini ukomeye Salman al-Awdah, afunzwe kuva mu 2017, bisa nkaho ari ukwihorera ku rubuga rwa Twitter ruvuguruzanya na politiki ya Arabiya Sawudite mu gihe cyo guha akato Qatar.
mt0: Iyo umuntu atamenya icyo ari cyo, umushumba w'umukobwa wa Alaoudh, Salman al-Awdah, ufite icyo ari cyo wese, amaze imyaka ibiri afunzwe, nk'uko bigaragara, kubera icyo yashyizeho kuri Twitter cyo guhura n'ibyo u Rwanda rwagiye rutangirira Qatar.

en: He is one of many detained in an apparent crackdown on dissent and those who could challenge Prince Mohammed's power.
kin: Ni umwe mu bantu benshi bafunzwe mu rwego rwo guhashya abatavuga rumwe n’ubutegetsi ndetse n’abashobora guhangana n’ubutegetsi bwa Muganwa Mohammed.
mt0: Iyi ni umwe mu bafashwe mu buryo bugaragara mu buryo bwo gukubita abanyabyaha n'abo bashobora guca inyuma ubwato bwa Prince Mohammed.

en: One of the most prominent examples is former crown prince Mohammed bin Nayef, the CIA ally respected in the West for his efforts to counter violent extremism, but who King Salman ousted from the line of succession.
kin: Imwe mu ngero zikomeye ni uwahoze ari igikomangoma cy’ikamba, Mohammed bin Nayef, umufasha wa CIA wubahwa mu Burengerazuba kubera umuhate we wo kurwanya ubuhezanguni, ariko Umwami Salman yirukanye ku murongo w'izungura.
mt0: Imwe mu mibereho izwi cyane ni Mohammed bin Nayef, umushoferi wa CIA ufite icyizere mu bihugu byo mu Burengero n'umuntu ufite icyizere mu bihugu byo mu Burengero, akaba yaragizwe umushoferi wa mbere ufite icyizere mu bihugu byo mu Burengero, ariko uwo umushoferi wa mbere ufite icyizere mu bihugu byo mu Burengero n'umuntu ufite icyizere mu bihugu byo mu Burengero.

en: Prince Nayef has not been seen in public since reports of his arrest in March 2020. His detention was never officially confirmed.

mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga ko ntabwo ubona Prince Nayef mu bantu bose kuva amakuru yatangajwe ko yafashwe muri Werurwe 2020. Iyo detention ntabwo yatangajwe n'ubutegetsi.

en: For government opponents, such cases reinforce questions about what difference the ongoing justice reforms will make.

en: "In my view, this is all window-dressing," said Madawi al-Rasheed, a U.K.-based academic and spokesperson for the opposition National Assembly Party founded by exiles.
kin: Madawi al-Rasheed, umunyeshuri ukomoka muri Leta zunze ubumwe za Amerika akaba n'umuvugizi w'ishyaka ry’inteko ishinga amategeko ritavuga rumwe n’ubutegetsi ryashinzwe n’abajyanywe mu bunyage, yagize ati: "Njye mbona, ibi byose byambaye idirishya".
mt0: "Nuko ntekereza ko ari igikorwa cyo gukora imibereho y'idirisha," says Madawi al-Rasheed, a U.K. academic and spokesman for the opposition National Assembly Party founded by exiles.

mt0: U.S. intelligence assessment found Prince Mohammed "approved" an operation to capture or kill Khashoggi, though Saudi officials deny this and say it was a "rogue" operation.

en: In April, before Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan visited Riyadh on Thursday and embraced Prince Mohammed, Turkey transferred the trial in absentia of 26 suspects in the Khashoggi case to Saudi Arabia.
kin: Muri Mata, mbere yuko Perezida wa Turkiya, Recep Tayyip Erdogan asura Riyadh ku wa kane maze ahobera igikomangoma Mohammed, Turukiya yimuriye urubanza adahari abantu 26 bakekwaho icyaha cya Khashoggi muri Arabiya Sawudite.
mt0: In April, mbere y’uko Perezida Recep Tayyip Erdogan ajya i Riyadh ku wa Kabiri n’amenya n’Umwami Mohammed, Turkey yashyize imbere y’ibyo ivuga ku bantu 26 bakurikiranyweho icyaha cya Khashoggi inyuma y’aho Perezida Recep Tayyip Erdogan ajya i Riyadh ku wa Kabiri n’amenya n’Umwami Mohammed.

en: Turkey's decision drew anguished protest from lawyers and Khashoggi's fiancée, who insisted Saudi courts couldn't possibly hold a credible trial.
kin: Icyemezo cya Turukiya cyamaganye abanyamategeko ndetse n'umukunzi wa Khashoggi, bashimangira ko inkiko zo muri Arabiya Sawudite zidashobora kuburanishwa mu buryo bwizewe.
mt0: Iyo hitamo ya Turkey yagaragaje ubwinshi bw’ibitekerezo by’abashingwamanza n’umugabo wa Khashoggi, uwo n’umugore we, bavuga ko ntabwo ari igikorwa cy’ubutungane cy’u Rwanda gishobora gukora.

en: For the loved ones of those locked away, Khashoggi's killing fuels a uniform fear of speaking out.
kin: Ku bakunzi bafunzwe, iyicwa rya Khashoggi ritera ubwoba bumwe bwo kuvuga.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa. Niba udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga ko utabizi.

en: "I want to, many do, but we're scared," said a friend of Prince Salman bin Abdulaziz, who has been detained along with his father since 2018.

mt0: "Nkunda, abantu benshi bashaka, ariko twari dutinya," amakuru y’umuvandimwe wa Prince Salman bin Abdulaziz yavuze.

en: "Everyone knows what happened to Khashoggi."

en: Now a prisoner, the 38-year-old claims he is no longer the fanatic he was then, enraged with a murderous hatred for non-Muslims. Captured in Turkey and extradited to Morocco, he is serving a 10-year prison term on terrorism charges.
kin: Noneho imfungwa, ufite imyaka 38 y'amavuko avuga ko atakiri umufana icyo gihe, yarakajwe n'inzangano z'ubwicanyi ku batari Abayisilamu. Yafatiwe muri Turukiya yoherezwa muri Maroc, akatiwe igifungo cy'imyaka 10 ashinjwa iterabwoba.
mt0: Ahora ari mu nzu, uwo mugabo w'imyaka 38 aravuga ko ntabwo ari uwo mufanani wari ukiri, ufite urukundo rwa genocide rwagiye rukuruza abantu batari Abaislamu. Yafashwe muri Turkey maze ajya muri Morocco, arafunzwa kubera icyaha cy'iterabwoba.

en: Now the former fighter has graduated with 14 other prisoners convicted of terror offenses from a Morocco de-radicalization program that might make them more eligible for an early release.
kin: Ubu uwahoze ari umurwanyi yahawe impamyabumenyi hamwe n’abandi bagororwa 14 bahamwe n’icyaha cy’iterabwoba muri gahunda ya Maroc de-radicalisation ishobora gutuma bemererwa kurekurwa hakiri kare.
mt0: Now the former fighter has graduated with 14 other prisoners convicted of terror offenses from a Morocco de-radicalization program that might make them more eligible for an early release.

en: The Associated Press and other media were invited to observe their graduation ceremony Thursday in a prison in Sale near the Moroccan capital, Rabat, and to interview some prisoners under monitored and controlled conditions. Prison administration officials picked out three men they said were willing to be interviewed.
kin: Ibiro ntaramakuru by'Abanyamerika Associated Press hamwe n'ibindi bitangazamakuru byatumiwe kureba umuhango wo gutanga impamyabumenyi ku wa kane muri gereza i Sale hafi y'umurwa mukuru wa Maroc, Rabat, no kubaza imfungwa zimwe na zimwe zikurikiranwa kandi zikagenzurwa. Abayobozi ba gereza batoye abagabo batatu bavuga ko bafite ubushake bwo kubazwa.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know

en: Officials stipulated that the inmates shouldn't be identified by their full names and that their faces mustn't be shown, citing privacy reasons.
kin: Abayobozi bavuze ko abagororwa batagomba kumenyekana ku mazina yabo yose kandi ko mu maso habo hatagomba kwerekanwa, kubera impamvu z’ibanga.
mt0: Officials stipulated that the inmates shouldn't be identified by their full names and that their faces mustn't be shown, citing privacy reasons.

en: But prison officials didn't listen to the interviews or intervene to shut down media lines of questioning or inmates' answers.
kin: Ariko abayobozi ba gereza ntibigeze bumva ibibazo cyangwa ngo bagire icyo bakora kugira ngo bahagarike umurongo w'itangazamakuru ryo kubaza cyangwa ibisubizo by'abagororwa.
mt0: Iyo umuntu atabyumva ntiyabyumvikana cyangwa ntabwo ashyira mu bikorwa icyo aricyo cyose kugira ngo ashyire imbere amakuru y'ibibazo cyangwa amakuru y'abafungwa.

en: The 15 inmates in crisp shirts and trousers stood solemnly for Morocco's national anthem and were handed certificates. Prison officials said the de-radicalization program consisted of three months of classes in prison on religion, law and economics, and that inmates also received training on how to start a business. These most recent graduates were the ninth batch since the program started in 2017.
kin: Abagororwa 15 bambaye amashati n'ipantaro bahagaze neza kubera indirimbo yubahiriza igihugu cya Maroc kandi bahabwa ibyemezo. Abayobozi ba gereza bavuze ko gahunda ya de-radicalisation yari igizwe n’amezi atatu muri gereza ku bijyanye n’idini, amategeko n’ubukungu, kandi ko abagororwa na bo bahawe amahugurwa y’uburyo bwo gutangiza umushinga. Aba barangije vuba ni icyiciro cya cyenda kuva gahunda yatangira muri 2017.
mt0: Iyo umuntu ashaka gukora icyo ashaka, ashyira imbere igihugu cye n'igihugu cye.

en: Moulay Idriss Agoulmam, the director of social-cultural action and prisoner reintegration at Morocco's prison administration, said the program is entirely voluntary and works with inmates "to change their behavior and improve their life path."
kin: Umuyobozi ushinzwe ibikorwa by’imibereho n’umuco no gusubiza mu buzima busanzwe imfungwa ku buyobozi bwa gereza ya Maroc, Moulay Idriss Agoulmam, yavuze ko iyi gahunda ari ubushake kandi ko ikorana n’abagororwa "guhindura imyitwarire yabo no kuzamura imibereho yabo."
mt0: Iyo ntabwo ufite icyo uvuga, umuntu ufite icyo uvuga ni Moulay Idriss Agoulmam, umuyobozi w'ibikorwa by'ubuzima n'ubushake mu ishami ry'igihugu ry'u Morocco, yavuze ko icyo kigo ari igikorwa cy'ubushake kandi cyita ku bantu "bagenda guhindura imyitwarire yabo kandi bigahindura uburyo bwo kubaho."

en: "It enables prisoners to form an awareness of the gravity of their mistakes," he said.
kin: Ati: "Bituma imfungwa zimenyekanisha uburemere bw'amakosa yabo".
mt0: "Iyi nzira ifasha abagororwa kumenya uko ibikorwa byabo bimeze," yagize ati.

en: Graduating from the program doesn't make inmates automatically eligible for early release, but does increase their chances of getting a royal pardon or a reduced sentence. That's been the case for just over half the program's 222 graduates so far, the prison administration says. Since 2019, the training has also been offered to women convicted under Morocco's Anti-Terrorism Act. Ten women have graduated so far — all of them since released, including eight with pardons.
kin: Kurangiza porogaramu ntibituma abagororwa bahita bemererwa kurekurwa hakiri kare, ariko byongera amahirwe yo kubona imbabazi zumwami cyangwa kugabanyirizwa ibihano. Ubuyobozi bwa gereza buvuga ko ibyo byabaye ku barenga kimwe cya kabiri cy'abanyeshuri 222 barangije porogaramu kugeza ubu. Kuva mu mwaka wa 2019, amahugurwa yahawe kandi abagore bahamwe n'icyaha hakurikijwe itegeko ryo kurwanya iterabwoba muri Maroc. Abagore icumi barangije kugeza ubu - bose kuva barekuwe, harimo umunani bafite imbabazi.
mt0: Iyo umuntu arangije uwo mugoroba ntabwo ashyirwa mu nzira yo gukora imibonano mpuzabitsina, ariko arushaho gukora imibonano mpuzabitsina n'umuntu ufite icyaha cy'iterabwoba.

en: Called "Moussalaha," meaning "reconciliation" in Arabic, the program is offered to prisoners who have demonstrated a readiness to disavow extremism.
kin: Iyi gahunda yiswe "Moussalaha," bisobanura "ubwiyunge" mucyarabu, iyi gahunda ihabwa imfungwa zagaragaje ko ziteguye kwanga ubuhezanguni.
mt0: Iyi nzira yitwa "Moussalaha," ivuga "uguhanahana", ishyirwa mu buryo bwo gufasha abagororwa bagaragaje ko bafite ubushake bwo guhunga ubutegetsi.

en: Mohsin said he left to fight in Syria in 2012. A school dropout as a teen, he said he "was virtually illiterate and couldn't discern good from bad." He said he was radicalized by people who showed him extremist videos "about the divine obligation to battle those who don't follow Islamic principles and to murder non-Muslims."
kin: "Mohsin yavuze ko yavuye kurwana muri Siriya mu 2012. Yataye ishuri akiri ingimbi, yavuze ko" "yari azi gusoma no kwandika kandi ko adashobora gutandukanya icyiza n'ikibi." " kubyerekeye inshingano ziva ku Mana zo kurwanya abadakurikiza amahame ya kisilamu no kwica abatari Abayisilamu. ""
mt0: Mohsin yavuze ko yagiye mu ntambara muri Syria mu 2012. Arangije amashuri y'amashyaka y'amashyaka y'abashyaka, yavuze ko "yari akiri muto cyane kandi ntabwo yari ashobora gutandukanya icyiza n'icyabibi." Yagize ati: "Ntabwo nari nshobora gutandukanya icyiza n'icyabibi."

en: In Syria, "I saw massacres, rapes, and thefts," he said. "I concluded after a time that the fight being conducted in the name of Islam had nothing to do with our religion."
kin: Ati: "Muri Siriya," Nabonye ubwicanyi, gufata ku ngufu n'ubujura ". "Nafashe umwanzuro nyuma y'igihe ko intambara ikorwa mu izina rya Islamu ntaho ihuriye n'idini ryacu."
mt0: In Syria, "Nabonaga ubwicanyi, urupfu n'ubujura," yagize ati. "Nuko nyuma y'igihe n'igihe n'icyo ntekereza ko ubwo buryo bwo kurwana mu izina ry'Imana nta gushidikanya n'idini ry'u Rwanda."

en: He escaped to Turkey in 2018 and was detained for a year there before being extradited to Morocco.
kin: Yahungiye muri Turukiya mu 2018, afungirwa umwaka umwe mbere yo koherezwa muri Maroc.
mt0: Iyo umuntu ashaka gusubira muri Turukiya mu 2018, yagiye gufatwa igihe cy’umwaka mbere yo gufatwa n’umuryango w’igihugu cy’Morocco.

en: He says he has now disavowed extremism.
kin: Avuga ko ubu yanze ubuhezanguni.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga ko amaze gukuraho ubutegetsi.

en: "That period of my life has passed," he said.
kin: Ati: "Icyo gihe cy'ubuzima bwanjye cyarashize."
mt0: "Icyo gihe cy'ubuzima bwanjye cyamaze gushira," yagize ati.

en: Numerous Moroccans have traveled to Syria, Iraq and elsewhere to join extremist groups. Morocco has also experienced multiple attacks itself. Five suicide attacks in Casablanca in 2003 killed 33 people. In 2011, an explosion destroyed a cafe in Marrakech, killing 17 people, most of them foreign tourists.
kin: Abanyamerika benshi bagiye muri Siriya, Iraki n'ahandi kugira ngo binjire mu mitwe y'intagondwa. Maroc nayo yahuye n'ibitero byinshi ubwayo. Ibitero bitanu byo kwiyahura byabereye i Casablanca mu 2003 byahitanye abantu 33. Mu 2011, igisasu cyaturikiye ikawa i Marrakech, gihitana abantu 17, abenshi muri bo bakaba ari ba mukerarugendo b'abanyamahanga.
mt0: Iyo umuntu atamenya icyo avuga, ntabwo ari umuntu ufite icyo avuga. Abantu benshi bo muri Morocco bagiye muri Syria, Iraki n’ahandi kugira ngo bagere mu ishyaka ry’abafatanyije n’ibitero by’abashoferi. Morocco yagize n’ibitero byinshi by’abashoferi.

en: Al Mustapaha Razrazi, a clinical psychologist and member of the program's scientific committee, said among 156 people who have been released after attending the courses, just one has been caught committing a crime again.
kin: Al Mustapaha Razrazi, inzobere mu by'imitekerereze ya muntu akaba n'umwe mu bagize komite ishinzwe ubumenyi muri iyo gahunda, yavuze ko mu bantu 156 barekuwe nyuma yo kwitabira amasomo, umwe gusa yongeye gufatwa akora icyaha.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga nti uzi. Al Mustapaha Razrazi, umuganga w'ubuvuzi akaba n'umuyobozi w'inama y'ubushakashatsi y'ikigo, yavuze ko muri bose bose bagera kuri 156 basohotse nyuma yo gukurikiranwa, umwe gusa akaba yaracyahariye ibindi.

en: That person was convicted of a non-terrorism-related offense, he said.
kin: Yavuze ko uwo muntu yahamijwe n'icyaha kijyanye n'iterabwoba.
mt0: Return only if you can't translate. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: Iran Gets Opportunity to Sell Auto Parts to Russian Carmaker
kin: Irani ibonye amahirwe yo kugurisha ibice by'imodoka ku Barusiya bakora imodoka.
mt0: Iran yahawe uburyo bwo kugura ibikoresho by'imodoka bya ruswa.

en: A member of Iran's syndicate of car parts manufacturers says Iranian producers have an opportunity to export their wares to a Russian carmaker, state media reported.
kin: Ibitangazamakuru bya Leta byatangaje ko umunyamuryango wa syndicat ya Irani y’ibicuruzwa by’imodoka avuga ko abakora muri Irani bafite amahirwe yo kohereza ibicuruzwa byabo mu ruganda rukora imodoka mu Burusiya.
mt0: A member of Iran's syndicate of car parts manufacturers says Iranian producers have an opportunity to export their wares to a Russian carmaker, state media reported.

en: The late Monday report quoted Hossein Bahrainian as saying "a prominent Russian car maker" requested parts from Iran. He did not name the manufacturer. He said it requested brake parts, airbags, air-conditioner parts and other components.
kin: Raporo yo ku wa mbere yarangiye ivuga ko Hossein Bahrein yavuze ko "uruganda rukomeye rw’imodoka yo mu Burusiya" rwasabye ibice muri Irani. Ntiyavuze uwabikoze. Yavuze ko isaba ibice bya feri, ibikapu byo mu kirere, ibyuma bifata ibyuma bikonjesha n'ibindi bikoresho.
mt0: Icyo gihe cy’umunsi wa mbere, amakuru yatangaje ko "a maker y’imodoka y’i Moscow" yagiye gusaba igikoresho cyo muri Irani. Ntiyigeze avuga uwo maker. en: Both Iran and Russia are under U.S. sanctions but the export of Iranian cars and car parts is not subject to sanctions.
kin: Irani n'Uburusiya byombi bihanishwa Amerika ariko kohereza imodoka za Irani n'ibice by'imodoka ntabwo bihanwa.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga ko udashobora kumenya ko Irani na Urusisiya bose bafite imisoro y’Amerika ariko ubutunzi bw’imodoka n’ibikoresho by’imodoka by’i Irani ntabwo bugomba gufatwa n’imisoro.

en: The import of automobiles to Iran is also not subject to sanctions. However, Tehran has not imported cars since 2018, after the U.S. withdrew from a nuclear deal between Iran and world powers and imposed oil and banking sanctions on Iran.
kin: Gutumiza imodoka muri Irani nabyo ntabwo bihanwa. Icyakora, Tehran ntabwo yatumije imodoka kuva mu 2018, nyuma y’uko Amerika ivuye mu masezerano ya kirimbuzi hagati ya Irani n’ibihugu by’isi ndetse ikanafatira Irani ibihano bya peteroli na banki.

en: Iran in recent years has exported car radiators and suspension systems to Russia. In the past it exported cars to Iraq, Syria and Venezuela.
kin: Irani mu myaka yashize yohereje mu Burusiya imirasire y’imodoka na sisitemu zo guhagarika. Kera yoherezaga imodoka muri Iraki, Siriya na Venezuwela.

en: Tehran and Moscow have had close relations in recent years, especially after Iran's sole nuclear power plant went online in 2011 with help from Russia.

en: Separately on Tuesday, Iran said it has played a mediatory role in the war in Ukraine.
kin: Ku wa kabiri, Irani yavuze ko yagize uruhare mu bunzi mu ntambara yo muri Ukraine.
mt0: Icyo gihe, ku wa Kabiri, Iran yatangaje ko yagize uruhare mu ntambara muri Ukraine.

en: "So far twice I have conveyed messages from the foreign minister of Ukraine to my Russian counterpart," said Foreign Minister Hossein Amir Abdollahian in a phone conversation with his Irish counterpart. He said Iran supports diplomatic solutions for restoring peace and stability.
kin: Minisitiri w’ububanyi n’amahanga Hossein Amir Abdollahian mu kiganiro kuri telefoni na mugenzi we wa Irlande yagize ati: "Kugeza ubu inshuro ebyiri zose nagejeje ubutumwa kuri minisitiri w’ububanyi n’amahanga wa Ukraine kuri mugenzi wanjye w’Uburusiya." Yavuze ko Irani ishyigikiye ibisubizo by’ububanyi n’amahanga mu kugarura amahoro n’amahoro.
mt0: "Kugeza ubu twice ntangaje messages zitukura n’umushikiranganji w’intebe wa Ukraine ku mushikiranganji w’umushikiranganji w’Uburusi," nk’uko Foreign Minister Hossein Amir Abdollahian yabwiye Irish counterpart. en: Abdollahian did not elaborate but said Iran "opposes war and displacement of human beings in Ukraine," and other paces like Yemen, the Palestinian lands and Afghanistan.
kin: Abdollahian ntabwo yabisobanuye ariko yavuze ko Irani "irwanya intambara no kwimura abantu muri Ukraine," ndetse n'indi ntera nka Yemeni, ibihugu bya Palesitine na Afuganisitani.
mt0: Abdollahian ntabwo yagize icyo avuga ariko yavuze ko Irani "yifuza ko abantu bahunga n'intambara n'ubutumwa bw'abantu mu Ukraine," n'ibindi bice by'isi nka Yemen, Palestine, Afghanistan.

en: Diversity, New Perspectives Are Applied to Middle East Coverage
kin: Dutandukanye, Ibitekerezo bishya bikoreshwa muburasirazuba bwo hagati
mt0: Diversity, New Perspectives Are Applied to Middle East Coverage

en: Natalia Sancha has always adopted a collaborative approach to journalism. When out on assignment, she speaks to others covering the same story about their perspectives.
kin: Nataliya Sancha yamye afata inzira yo gufatanya mubanyamakuru. Iyo asohotse mukoro, avugana nabandi bavuga inkuru imwe kubitekerezo byabo.
mt0: Natalia Sancha always adopted a collaborative approach to journalism. When out on assignment, she speaks to others covering the same story about their perspectives.

en: This partly stems from an interest in telling underreported stories, but as a female journalist in a male-dominated region, she says collaboration and supporting the women she works with have always been important.
kin: Ibi bimwe bituruka ku gushimishwa no kuvuga inkuru zidasobanutse, ariko nkumunyamakuru wumugore mukarere kariganjemo abagabo, avuga ko ubufatanye no gutera inkunga abagore bakorana byahoze ari ngombwa.
mt0: Iyi nkuru iturutse ku rukundo rwo kuvuga amakuru y’inyuma, ariko nk’umunyamakuru w’umugore mu gice cy’abagabo, avuga ko collaboration n’ugufasha abakobwa bakorera hamwe byagiye bishyira mu ruhande rwabo.

en: "I would talk to male and female journalists, and I always realized that women had a similar perspective, because we had similar experiences while covering the story," the 42-year-old journalist said.
kin: Umunyamakuru w'imyaka 42 yagize ati: "Naganiriye n'abanyamakuru b'abagabo n'abagore, kandi buri gihe nabonaga ko abagore bafite imyumvire imwe, kuko natwe twagize ibyabaye mugihe twatangaga inkuru".
mt0: Iyo nkunda kuvuga n’abagabo n’abagore, nkunda gufata icyemezo ko abagore bafite icyo bafite, kuko twagize icyo duhura igihe twakora akazi," uwo munyamakuru w’imyaka 42 yavuze.

en: That collaborative approach came into play in 2020 when a publisher asked Sancha if she was interested in writing a book about Syria.
kin: Ubwo buryo bwo gufatanya bwatangiye gukurikizwa mu 2020 ubwo umubwiriza yabazaga Sancha niba ashishikajwe no kwandika igitabo kivuga kuri Siriya.
mt0: Iyo nzira y’ubufatanye yagiyeho mu 2020 igihe amakuru yashyizweho n’umunyamakuru y’i Syria ashaka ko Sancha yazandika igitabo ku bya Syria.

en: She countered with a better offer.
kin: Yarwanyije icyifuzo cyiza.
mt0: Return only the translated translation. If you can't translate simply say you don't know.

en: "I told him that a collective narrative by women journalists about the broader region would have a different effect," she said. "I could have written the book myself, but it would not have the same sense."
kin: Ati: "Namubwiye ko inkuru rusange y'abanyamakuru b'abagore ivuga ku karere kanini byagira ingaruka zitandukanye." "Nanjye ubwanjye nashoboraga kwandika igitabo, ariko ntabwo cyari kumva kimwe."
mt0: Icyo nshaka ni uko nzamubwira ko igitekerezo cy’abamenyeshamakuru b’abagore ku byerekeye igice cy’igihugu gishobora kugira ingaruka zitandukanye. "Nshobora kuba nshyizeho igitekerezo njye, ariko ntabwo byagira ingaruka imwe."

en: Originally from Andalusia in southern Spain, Sancha spent the past 14 years in the Middle East covering conflicts in Iraq, Syria and Yemen, and reporting from Egypt, Lebanon and Tunisia.
kin: Sancha ukomoka muri Andalusiya mu majyepfo ya Espagne, Sancha yamaze imyaka 14 ishize mu burasirazuba bwo hagati yerekana amakimbirane yo muri Iraki, Siriya na Yemeni, kandi atanga raporo avuye muri Egiputa, Libani na Tuniziya.

en: She has been working more recently with the European Union communications department, after leaving Beirut for health reasons following a mass explosion that rocked the city in 2020.
kin: Aherutse gukorana n’ishami ry’itumanaho ry’umuryango w’ubumwe bw’ibihugu by’Uburayi, nyuma yo kuva i Beirut kubera impamvu z’ubuzima nyuma y’igiturika kinini cyibasiye umujyi muri 2020.
mt0: Iyo umuntu ashaka gukora akazi n'umuryango w'ubumwe bw'Uburayi nyuma yo kuva i Beirut kubera impamvu z'ubuzima nyuma y'aho igitero cy'abantu benshi cyagize ingaruka mbi ku muryango w'Uburayi mu 2020.

en: Women "have a different experience because we would go to places that our male colleagues were not used to. Not because we're smarter, but just because the majority of the region is still Arab, Muslim and gender-segregated," Sancha told VOA.

en: Having women reporters has an impact, she noted.

mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga uti ntabwo uzi.

en: "If I put myself in the position of the reader, I would prefer to have a woman telling me the story because it is going to be about 100 percent of the population, which means you are going to have a more inclusive narrative on the conflict."

en: For her book, Sancha reached out to other women who cover the Middle East, to ensure diverse perspectives from foreign and local reporters.

en: The result of the nearly two-year collaboration is Bullets for All, released in Spanish in April.
kin: Ibisubizo byubufatanye bwimyaka hafi ibiri ni Bullets kuri Bose, yasohotse mu cyesipanyoli muri Mata.
mt0: Resulta de la colaboración de casi dos años es el álbum Bullets for All, que se lanzó en abril en Spanish.

en: In the book, "we tell one story with different voices that represent all the women" from the region, Sancha said.
kin: Muri iki gitabo, Sancha yagize ati: "Muri iki gitabo," tuvuga inkuru imwe n'amajwi atandukanye ahagarariye abagore bose ".
mt0: Inkuru y'ibi ivuga ko "twivuga igitekerezo kimwe n'amagambo atandukanye agaragaza bose n'abagore bo mu ntara", nk'uko Sancha yavuze.

en: Each offers a personal perspective on covering historic moments, including the collapse of autocratic governments, popular protest movements and war. It also examines the discrimination and harassment women face in the newsroom and on assignment.
kin: Buri kimwe gitanga icyerekezo cyihariye cyo kwerekana ibihe byamateka, harimo gusenyuka kwa guverinoma yigenga, imyigaragambyo yamamaye nintambara. Irasuzuma kandi ivangura n'ihohoterwa abagore bahura nabyo mu cyumba cy'amakuru no ku mukoro.

en: Understanding language and culture goes a long way toward making progress in the region, says Maya Gebeily. The Reuters bureau chief for Lebanon, Syria and Jordan is one of the contributors to the book.
kin: Maya Gebeily avuga ko gusobanukirwa ururimi n'umuco bigana inzira igana ku iterambere. Umuyobozi w'ikigo cya Reuters muri Libani, Siriya na Yorodani ni umwe mu bagize uruhare muri iki gitabo.
mt0: Understand language and culture goes a long way toward making progress in the region, says Maya Gebeily. The Reuters bureau chief for Lebanon, Syria and Jordan is one of the contributors to the book.

en: "There's a lot to say and show from the perspective of women reporters who were also then influenced by the women that they met as they were doing their reporting," she said.
kin: Ati: "Hariho byinshi byo kuvuga no kwerekana nkurikije uko abanyamakuru b'abagore na bo bahise bayoborwa n'abagore bahuye igihe bakoraga raporo zabo".

en: Born in the U.S. to Lebanese parents, Gebeily started her journalism career in 2013 with a local news site in Beirut, Lebanon. She went on to cover the region for Agence France-Presse before joining Reuters.
kin: Gebeily yavukiye muri Amerika ku babyeyi bo muri Libani, yatangiye umwuga we w'itangazamakuru mu 2013 akoresheje urubuga rw'amakuru i Beirut, muri Libani. Yakomeje yerekeza mu karere ka Agence France-Presse mbere yo kwinjira muri Reuters.
mt0: Igihe yavukiye muri Leta Zunze Ubumwe za Amerika, Gebeily yatanguye akazi ry’ubumenyeshamakuru mu 2013 n’urubuga rwa mbere rwa Beirut, Lebanon. Yagiye inyuma kugira ngo akurikirane igice cyo mu Rwanda mbere yo gufata akazi muri Agence France-Presse.

en: Gebeily said her American and Lebanese background helped her understand the region better, which in turn has shaped her reporting. Knowing the local language is an important part of that.
kin: Gebeily yavuze ko amateka ye y'Abanyamerika na Libani yamufashije kumva neza akarere, ari nako kagize uruhare mu gutanga raporo. Kumenya ururimi rwaho nigice cyingenzi cyibyo.
mt0: Iyo nkuru yagize ati: "Iyi nkuru yagize ingaruka ku buryo yashoboye gusobanukirwa neza n'iki gice cy'isi, icyo rero cyagize ingaruka ku buryo yashoboye gusobanukirwa neza n'ibyo amakuru avuga. Kumenya igice cy'iki gice ni igice gikomeye cy'iyo nkuru.

en: "When interviewing a minister or a displaced person or an activist, the most important element is getting their trust," she said. "If you're able to speak the language and make them feel comfortable from the beginning, it changes everything. It grants you a very beautiful kind of access."
kin: Ati: "Iyo ubajije minisitiri cyangwa umuntu wimuwe cyangwa umurwanashyaka, ikintu cy'ingenzi ni ukugirira icyizere." "Niba ushoboye kuvuga ururimi no gutuma bumva bamerewe neza kuva mu ntangiriro, bihindura byose. Iraguha uburyo bwiza cyane bwo kwinjira."

en: That knowledge helped when Abbas, 34, was on assignment with Sancha in March 2021. They traveled to a Kurdish-run detention camp in northeast Syria and interviewed female jihadists affiliated with IS, for a story in El Pais.
kin: Ubwo bumenyi bwafashije igihe Abbas w'imyaka 34 yari mu butumwa na Sancha muri Werurwe 2021. Baragiye mu kigo cy’imfungwa cy’Abanyakorde mu majyaruguru y’amajyaruguru ya Siriya maze babaza abajihadiste b’abagore bafitanye isano na IS, kugira ngo babone inkuru muri El Pais.

en: "While in Qamishli [in northeast Syria], I ran into two British journalists, very good colleagues of mine, who were disappointed after Shamima Begum and other women at the camp refused to talk to them," Sancha said, referring to a young woman who left her home in Britain aged 15 to join IS.
kin: Sancha yagize ati: "Nkiri i Qamishli [mu majyaruguru y'uburasirazuba bwa Siriya], nahungiye mu banyamakuru babiri b'Abongereza, abo dukorana cyane, batengushye nyuma yuko Shamima Begum n'abandi bagore bari mu nkambi banze kuvugana nabo." wavuye iwe mu Bwongereza afite imyaka 15 yinjira muri IS.
mt0: "Ngiye muri Qamishli [mu majyaruguru y’igihugu cya Syria], nsanganye n’abamenyeshamakuru ba Britain bafite icyo bavuga, amakuru y’uko bavugaga ko ababajwe n’uko Shamima Begum n’izindi n’abagore bo mu kambi ntibashobora kuvugana nabo," Sancha yavuze, avuga ko ababyeyi ba Shamima Begum n’abandi n’abagore bo mu kambi ntibashobora kuvugana nabo.

en: "Their fixer was a man, so the jihadist women didnt talk to them because they are radical, and they dont talk to men. But then I was able to sit with Shamima and other women, who gave fantastic interviews from inside their tents," Sancha said.
kin: "Umukosora wabo yari umugabo, ku buryo abagore ba jihadiste batavuganye nabo kubera ko ari intagondwa, kandi ntibavugana n'abagabo. Ariko rero nashoboye kwicarana na Shamima n'abandi bagore, batanga ibiganiro bitangaje bivuye mu mahema yabo." Sancha ati.
mt0: "Iyo umuntu wari umuntu ufite icyo uvuga, ntiyavugana n'aba jihadist n'abo bantu nk'uko ari abaradikali, kandi ntibahamagaye abantu. Ariko nyuma y'aho n'abandi bantu n'abagore bafite icyo bavugaga, bavuga neza uko bavugaga bavugaga.

en: Abbas had a role in getting to talk to those women, she added.

en: "Ordinary people in our region were used to seeing women pick up arms and fight, but they werent used to seeing a woman hold a camera on the streets and on front lines," Abbas said. "It took a lot of sacrificing for me to convince my family and society that Im as good, if not better, as my male colleagues."

en: Journalism appealed to her because the story of the Middle East has often been told by male journalists, both local and foreign.
kin: Itangazamakuru ryaramushimishije kubera ko inkuru yo mu burasirazuba bwo hagati yagiye ivugwa n'abanyamakuru b'abagabo, baba abo mu mahanga ndetse n'abanyamahanga.
mt0: Igihe yajya mu itangazamakuru, yagize icyo ivuga n'uko amakuru y'i Middle East akunda gushikirizwa n'abagabo, yaba abanyagihugu n'abanyamahanga.

en: "The narrative hasnt changed because of that, but if local and international women journalists get a real chance to tell the story of the Middle East, that narrative could change, which would affect the way others see this region," Abbas said.

en: But fewer people are attending religious services, and the decline of churches and other houses of worship threatens to leave a void that could potentially be filled by coffee shops.

en: "For so much of American history, the church has really been — or their congregations have really been — essential, providing an unheralded role in providing cohesion and connectedness in communities … encouraging civic engagement and political participation," says Daniel Cox, director of the Survey Center on American Life and a senior fellow at the American Enterprise Institute.

en: Third places Lack of involvement and affiliation with churches, mosques and synagogues means people might be missing out on what urban sociologist Ray Oldenburg dubbed as "third places" — public gathering spots that offer something that home, the "first place," and work, the "second place," might not.
kin: Umwanya wa gatatu Kutagira uruhare no gufatanya n'amatorero, imisigiti n'amasinagogi bivuze ko abantu bashobora kubura icyo umuhanga mubya societologue wo mumijyi Ray Oldenburg yise "umwanya wa gatatu" - ahantu hateranira abantu benshi batanga ikintu murugo, "umwanya wa mbere," nakazi, "umwanya wa kabiri," ntabwo.

en: Oldenburg argued that third places are critical to a communitys social vitality.

en: An October 2021 survey conducted by the American Survey Center found that commercial spaces like coffee houses foster trust and connection in American communities and could help fill the void left by churches.
kin: Ubushakashatsi bwakozwe mu Kwakira 2021 bwakozwe n’ikigo cy’Abanyamerika gishinzwe ubushakashatsi bwerekanye ko ahantu h’ubucuruzi nk’amazu ya kawa bitera kwizerana no guhuza imiryango y'Abanyamerika kandi bikaba byafasha kuziba icyuho cyasizwe n'amatorero.
mt0: Return only. If you can't translate simply say you don't know An October 2021 survey conducted by the American Survey Center found that commercial spaces like coffee houses foster trust and connection in American communities and could help fill the void left by churches.

en: "If you're a regular at a cafe, the barista may know what you usually order, and they can make it for you, and that feels good," says clinical psychologist Dr. Maria Espinola, an assistant professor in the Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Neuroscience at the University of Cincinnati College of Medicine.
kin: Inzobere mu by'imitekerereze ya muntu, Dr. Maria Espinola, umwarimu wungirije mu ishami ry’indwara zo mu mutwe, agira ati: "Niba usanzwe muri cafe, barista irashobora kumenya icyo usanzwe utumiza, kandi barashobora kukugukorera, kandi ibyo ni byiza." na Neuroscience Imyitwarire muri kaminuza ya Cincinnati College of Medicine.
mt0: "Niba uri umushoferi w'icafe, barista ashobora kumenya ibyo ukunda kugura, kandi bashobora kubyubaka, kandi ibyo byo ni byiza," says Dr. Maria Espinola, assistant professor in the Department of Psychiatry and Behavioral Neuroscience at the University of Cincinnati College of Medicine.

en: "It feels good to be recognized, to know that people are expecting you, to know that people care about you, to know that you belong, because the need for belonging and human connection is a fundamental need that we all have, and it's important to have that fulfilled in different ways," Espinola says.
kin: "Ni byiza kumenyekana, kumenya ko abantu bagutegereje, kumenya ko abantu bakwitayeho, kumenya ko uri uwawe, kuko gukenera kuba hamwe no guhuza abantu nikintu cyibanze twese dufite, kandi ni ngombwa kugira ngo ibyo bisohozwe mu buryo butandukanye, "Espinola.
mt0: "Ni byiza kumenya ko abantu bagutekereza, kumenya ko abantu bagukunda, kumenya ko abantu bagukunda, kumenya ko ufite icyo ushaka, kumenya ko ufite icyo ushaka, kuko umuntu ufite icyo ushaka, kandi ni byiza ko ufite ibyo ushaka byose, kandi ni byiza ko ufite ibyo ushaka byose."

en: In 2019, 67% of people surveyed said they have a third place — a coffee shop, bar, restaurant, park or other place in their community that they visit regularly.

en: "What we found was that people who had a third place were much more connected to their community," says Cox. "They're much more likely to engage in other activities there.

en: The respondents headed cities with at least 75,000 residents. The local leaders are still focused on traditional issues such as violent crime, the economy and infrastructure, but they are most concerned about the pandemics long-term impact on the mental health of their constituents.
kin: Ababajijwe bayoboye imijyi byibuze abaturage 75.000. Abayobozi b'inzego z'ibanze baracyibanda ku bibazo gakondo nk'ibyaha by'urugomo, ubukungu n'ibikorwa remezo, ariko bahangayikishijwe cyane n'ingaruka z'icyorezo ku buzima bwo mu mutwe bw'abatoye.

en: Mental health was top of mind for Michael Udine when he was sworn in as mayor of Broward County, Florida, in November 2021.

en: "Everything that was a potential issue pre-pandemic has pretty much been exacerbated by the pandemic," he says.

en: "There were issues going into the pandemic, and it was becoming more and more important on everyone's radar screen about the mental health of people of all ages. And I think the pandemic pretty much supercharged those issues."
kin: "Hariho ibibazo byagiye mu cyorezo, kandi byagendaga birushaho kuba ingenzi kuri ecran ya radar ya buri muntu ku bijyanye n'ubuzima bwo mu mutwe bw'abantu b'ingeri zose. Kandi ndatekereza ko icyorezo cyarenze ibyo bibazo."
mt0: "Hari ibibazo byagiye mbere y’iyo pandemi, kandi byagiye bishyira imbaraga zikomeye ku ruhande rwa buri wese kugira ngo abantu bafite amakuru y’ubuzima bw’abantu bose. Ntekereza ko icyo gihe cyabaye cyo gushyuha icyo kibazo."

en: It is not unusual for large outbreaks of disease to have a negative impact on mental health, according to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, which reports that rates of anxiety and depressive disorders among adults increased during the pandemic.

en: The pandemic has also adversely influenced the emotional and mental health of about one-third of Americas youth.

en: "What we've seen is just such anxiety, kids who wouldn't ordinarily have a meltdown, because it's so much change and difficulty adjusting to transitions," Maryland psychologist Mary Karapetian Alvord told VOA last month. "We've also seen a lot more sadness and depression."

"Twabonye kandi umubabaro mwinshi no kwiheba."

en: Early on in the pandemic, mayors were more focused on city operations, budget shortfalls and the threat the pandemic posed to small businesses, according to David Glick, an associate professor of political science at Boston University and a co-author of the 2021 Menino Survey of Mayors.

en: "Some of those concerns still remain, but what we saw more of in 2021 … is concern about some of the long-term impacts on individual residents," Glick says.

en: The asking price of apartment rentals was up 10.7% in September 2021 compared to last year at the same time, according to the National Association of Realtors (NAR).

en: "It's a hot market. We have never seen this market so hot in the last decade," says Gay Cororaton, NARs senior economist and director of housing and commercial research. "The average rent growth, year-over-year, is about 3-to-5%. We're seeing 11% rent growth now, so, clearly, way above trends weve had in the past."
kin: Gay Cororaton, impuguke mu by'ubukungu akaba n'umuyobozi ushinzwe imiturire n'ubushakashatsi mu bucuruzi, agira ati: "Ni isoko rishyushye. Ntabwo twigeze tubona iri soko rishyushye cyane mu myaka icumi ishize."

en: The Biden administration has begun expelling Cubans and Nicaraguans to Mexico under pandemic-related powers to deny migrants a chance to seek asylum, expanding use of the rule even as it publicly says it has been trying to unwind it, officials said Wednesday.
kin: Ku wa gatatu, abayobozi bavuze ko ubuyobozi bwa Biden bwatangiye kwirukana Abanyakanani na Nikaragwa muri Mexico kubera ububasha bujyanye n’icyorezo bwo kwima abimukira amahirwe yo gusaba ubuhungiro, kwagura ikoreshwa ry’iryo tegeko nubwo rivuga ku mugaragaro ko ryagerageje kubireka.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura icyo uvuga gusa uvuga ko udashobora kumenya.

en: The U.S. struck agreement with Mexico to expel up to 100 Cubans and 20 Nicaraguans a day from three locations: San Diego; El Paso, Texas; and Rio Grande Valley, Texas, according to a U.S. official with direct knowledge of the effort.
kin: Amerika yagiranye amasezerano na Mexico yo kwirukana abanya Cuba 100 na Nikaragwa 20 kumunsi ahantu hatatu: San Diego; El Paso, muri Texas; n'ikibaya cya Rio Grande, muri Texas, nk'uko byatangajwe n'umuyobozi wa Amerika ufite ubumenyi butaziguye bw'imbaraga.
mt0: U.S. struck agreement with Mexico to expel up to 100 Cubans and 20 Nicaraguans a day from three locations: San Diego; El Paso, Texas; and Rio Grande Valley, Texas, according to a U.S. official with direct knowledge of the effort.

en: The expulsions began April 27 and will end May 22, the official told The Associated Press on condition of anonymity because the agreement has not been made public.
kin: Iyirukanwa ryatangiye ku ya 27 Mata rikazarangira ku ya 22 Gicurasi, nk'uko uyu muyobozi yabitangarije ibiro ntaramakuru by'Abanyamerika kugira ngo atamenyekana kubera ko ayo masezerano atashyizwe ahagaragara.

en: They are carried out under Title 42 authority, a public health law that has been used to expel migrants on grounds of preventing spread of COVID-19. Title 42 is due to expire May 23, unless a judge intervenes.

en: Until last week, Mexico only agreed to take Guatemalans, Hondurans and El Salvadorans — in addition to Mexicans — under Title 42 authority. Other nationalities are subject to Title 42 but costs, strained diplomatic ties and other considerations often make it difficult to send them back to their home countries.

en: It's next to impossible for the U.S. to expel migrants to Cuba or Nicaragua because of poor relations with those governments.
kin: Bikurikira ntibishoboka ko Amerika yirukana abimukira muri Cuba cyangwa Nikaragwa kubera umubano mubi na guverinoma.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa. Ni igikorwa cy'ingenzi cyane kugira ngo u Rwanda n'Ubushinwa bavuge ko ari igihugu cy'abanyabyaha.

en: That has posed a challenge for the Biden administration as more people from those countries seek haven in the United States.
kin: Ibyo byateje ikibazo ubuyobozi bwa Biden mugihe abantu benshi baturuka muri ibyo bihugu bashaka ubuhungiro muri Amerika.
mt0: Ibyo byagize ingaruka ku ntwaro ya Biden nk’uko abantu benshi baturutse muri izo nsi bashaka gucumbika mu Leta Zunze Ubumwe.

en: Cubans were stopped by U.S. authorities more than 32,000 times on the Mexican border in March, double the number in February and more than five times October's count, according to U.S. Customs and Border Protection. Nicaragua eased travel restrictions from Cuba in November, making it easier for Cubans to continue by land to the U.S. border. Most enter the U.S. in or near Yuma, Arizona, and Del Rio, Texas.
kin: Nk’uko byatangajwe na gasutamo ya Leta zunze ubumwe za Amerika, ngo abanya Cuba bahagaritswe n'abayobozi b'Abanyamerika inshuro zirenga 32.000 ku mupaka wa Mexico, bakubye kabiri muri Gashyantare ndetse bakubye inshuro zirenga eshanu Ukwakira. Nikaragwa yorohereje imbogamizi z’ingendo ziva muri Cuba mu Gushyingo, byorohereza Abanyakanada gukomeza ku butaka kugera ku mupaka wa Amerika. Benshi binjira muri Amerika cyangwa hafi ya Yuma, Arizona, na Del Rio, Texas.

en: Nicaraguans were stopped more than 16,000 times in March, more than double September's level. The vast majority enter in South Texas.
kin: Muri Werurwe, Nikaragwa yahagaritswe inshuro zirenga 16.000, irenga inshuro ebyiri Nzeri. Umubare munini winjira muri Texas yepfo.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga ko Nicaraguans bafashwe 16,000 igihe muri Werurwe, igipimo cy’ibyo umuntu ashobora gufata n’umubare w’ukwezi kwa Nyakanga. Icya mbere ni uko abantu benshi bagerageza gukora ingendo mu ntara ya Texas.

en: Lifting Title 42 has proved controversial as midterm elections near, even for Biden's Democratic Party, amid concerns that the U.S. is unprepared for an anticipated increase in migrants seeking asylum. Authorities stopped migrants more than 221,000 times in March, the highest mark in 22 years.
kin: Kuzamura Umutwe wa 42 byagaragaye ko bitavugwaho rumwe nk’amatora yo hagati, ndetse no mu ishyaka rya demokarasi rya Biden, mu gihe hari impungenge z’uko Amerika ititeguye kwiyongera kw’abimukira bashaka ubuhungiro. Muri Werurwe, abategetsi bahagaritse abimukira inshuro zirenga 221.000, kikaba aricyo kintu kinini mu myaka 22.

en: The White House and Homeland Security Department have publicly stood behind the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's decision to end the measure because it could no longer be justified on grounds of protecting public health.

en: But the practice of expelling Cubans and Nicaraguans runs counter to the administration's public statements that it was phasing out use of the pandemic powers to prepare for May 23.
kin: Ariko imyitozo yo kwirukana abanya Cuba na Nikaragwa irahabanye n’ubuyobozi bwatangaje ko bwagiye bukuraho imbaraga z’icyorezo kugira ngo bitegure ku ya 23 Gicurasi.
mt0: Iyi nzira yo gukura abanyacubansi n'abanyanicaransi igiye guhura n'ibyo ufite n'ibyo uvuga ko ufite imbaraga zo gukoresha imbaraga z'ubuzima bwo kwitegura umunsi wa 23 Mukakaro.

en: The U.S. has expelled migrants more than 1.8 million times under Title 42 authority since March 2020, effectively overriding rights to seek asylum under U.S. law and international treaty. In doing so, migrants are not subject to immigration law, which include rights to seek protection from persecution at home.
kin: Kuva muri Werurwe 2020, Amerika yirukanye abimukira inshuro zirenga miliyoni 1.8 ku butegetsi bwa Umutwe wa 42, bivuguruza uburenganzira bwo gusaba ubuhungiro hakurikijwe amategeko ya Amerika n'amasezerano mpuzamahanga. Mu kubikora, abimukira ntibagengwa n'amategeko y’abinjira, akubiyemo uburenganzira bwo kurindwa ibitotezo mu ngo.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know The U.S. has expelled migrants more than 1.8 million times under Title 42 authority since March 2020, effectively overriding rights to seek asylum under U.S. law and international treaties. In doing so, migrants are not subject to immigration law, which include rights to seek protection from persecution at home.

en: The administration said in court filings that it began processing more Central American adults under immigration laws after the CDC's announcement on April 1. But a federal judge in Louisiana ruled last week that it couldn't start unwinding Title 42 while it was still in effect.
kin: Ubuyobozi bwatangaje mu rukiko ko bwatangiye gutunganya abantu benshi bakuze bo muri Amerika yo Hagati bakurikiza amategeko y’abinjira nyuma y’uko CDC ibitangaza ku ya 1 Mata.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura ijambo ryose, vuga nti uzi ko ufite icyo uvuga.

en: U.S. District Judge Robert Summerhays strongly criticized the CDC's decision, suggesting he would try to keep Title 42 in effect after May 23. A hearing is scheduled May 13 for oral arguments.
kin: Umucamanza w'akarere ka Amerika, Robert Summerhays, yanenze cyane icyemezo cya CDC, avuga ko azagerageza gukomeza Umutwe wa 42 nyuma y'itariki ya 23 Gicurasi.
mt0: U.S. District Judge Robert Summerhays yagize icyo avuga ko ashaka gushyira imbere icyemezo cya CDC, avuga ko ashaka gushyira imbere icyemezo cya Title 42 nyuma ya May 23. Aburanira imbere y’ubutungane tariki 13 Mukakaro.

en: Marisa Limon, senior director of advocacy and planning at the Hope Border Institute, said advocates began learning about expulsions of Cubans and Nicaraguans from El Paso on Monday and later confirmed the new practice with U.S. officials.
kin: Umuyobozi mukuru ushinzwe ubuvugizi n’igenamigambi mu kigo cya Hope Border, Marisa Limon, yavuze ko abunganizi batangiye kwiga ibijyanye no kwirukana Abanyakanani na Nikaragwa muri El Paso ku wa mbere nyuma baza kwemeza imikorere mishya hamwe n’abayobozi ba Amerika.
mt0: Marisa Limon, umuyobozi mukuru w’ubufatanye n’ubushakashatsi muri Hope Border Institute, yavuze ko abashinzwe ibikorwa by’ubufatanye batanguye kumenya ibyo abantu ba Cubans na Nicaraguans bagiye gusohoka muri El Paso ku wa mbere kandi nyuma y’aho bamenyekanye icyo cyemezo n’abashingamateka.

en: Limon said the administration is "trying to get every last bit out of Title 42" before it expires.
kin: Limon yavuze ko ubuyobozi "bugerageza gukuramo buri kintu cya nyuma mu mutwe wa 42" kitararangira.

en: Mexico Relocates Migrant Camp; Haitians Appear at Border
kin: Mexico yimuye inkambi y'abimukira; Abanyahayitiya bagaragara kumupaka
mt0: Relocate Migrant Camp; Haitians appear at the Border

en: Mexican authorities said Tuesday they have relocated a migrant camp that sprung up in a park in the border city of Reynosa, moving about 2,000 people from Central America and Haiti to a shelter in the city, across the border from McAllen, Texas.
kin: Ku wa kabiri, abategetsi ba Mexico bavuze ko bimuye inkambi y’abimukira yavukiye muri parike iri mu mujyi wa Reynosa uhana imbibi, yimura abantu bagera ku 2000 bava muri Amerika yo Hagati na Haiti mu buhungiro mu mujyi, hakurya y’umupaka na McAllen, muri Texas.
mt0: Mexican authorities said Tuesday they have relocated a migrant camp that sprung up in a park in the border city of Reynosa, moving about 2,000 people from Central America and Haiti to a shelter in the city, across the border from McAllen, Texas.

en: The camp of migrants mainly from Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras and Haiti sprung up after U.S. officials, citing the pandemic, invoked a health rule that denies migrants a chance to seek asylum.
kin: Inkambi y'abimukira ahanini baturutse muri Guatemala, El Salvador, Honduras na Haiti imaze kuvuka nyuma yuko abayobozi ba Amerika, bavuga ko iki cyorezo, basabye itegeko ry’ubuzima ryanga abimukira amahirwe yo gusaba ubuhungiro.

en: Mexico's National Immigration Institute said the migrants were taken around midnight Monday to the shelter, which it said will have better hygiene and food services.
kin: Ikigo cy'igihugu gishinzwe abinjira n'abasohoka muri Mexico cyatangaje ko abimukira bajyanywe mu gicuku cyo ku wa mbere bakajya mu buhungiro, buvuga ko buzagira isuku na serivisi nziza.
mt0: Iyo ntabwo umuntu abizi, gusa uvuga ko abantu bagerageza gukora icyo bashaka, n'ubwo icyo cyiciro cy'ibyo abaturage bavuga ko kizagira imiterere n'ubuzima bworoshye.

en: But on Monday, people in another border city, Nuevo Laredo, said hundreds of migrants, mainly Haitians, have streamed into that city, which is across the border from Laredo, Texas
kin: Ariko ku wa mbere, abantu bo mu wundi mujyi uhana imbibi, Nuevo Laredo, bavuze ko abimukira babarirwa mu magana, cyane cyane Abanyahayiti, binjiye muri uwo mujyi, uhana imbibi na Laredo, muri Texas.
mt0: Iyo umuntu ashaka kumenya icyo aricyo, ntabwo ari umuntu ufite icyo avuga. Abantu bo mu yindi nzu y’i Nuevo Laredo, y’amajyaruguru y’igihugu cya Texas, bavuga ko abantu bagera kuri 100,000, abaturage bo mu Rwanda, bavuze ko baje mu nzu y’i Nuevo Laredo, y’amajyaruguru y’igihugu cya Texas.

en: The rush apparently started after the U.S. began processing some asylum-seekers there.
kin: Kwihuta bigaragara ko byatangiye nyuma yuko Amerika itangiye gutunganya bamwe mubasaba ubuhungiro.
mt0: Iyi rush igaragara igiye nyuma yuko Leta Zunze Ubumwe za Amerika batanguye gufata abantu bamwe bamwe bagerageza gukora imibereho y’abantu.

en: The Catholic bishop of Nuevo Laredo said Monday that migrant shelters there are overcrowded, with some migrants sleeping outside in tents.
kin: Umwepiskopi gatolika wa Nuevo Laredo yavuze ku wa mbere ko aho abimukira bahurira huzuye, aho abimukira bamwe baryama hanze mu mahema.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura gusa uvuga ko imiryango y’abashyitsi igiye guhura n’umunaniro, ndetse n’abanyegihugu bamwe bamwe bafite uburyo bwo kuryama mu nzu.

en: Bishop Enrique Sánchez Martínez said migrants started streaming into Nuevo Laredo in late April, though the city isn't usually popular among migrants, in part because it is dominated by the violent Northeast drug cartel.
kin: Musenyeri Enrique Sánchez Martínez yavuze ko abimukira batangiye kwinjira muri Nuevo Laredo mu mpera za Mata, nubwo uyu mujyi udakunzwe cyane n'abimukira, kubera ko wiganjemo amakarito y’ibiyobyabwenge yo mu majyaruguru y'uburasirazuba.
mt0: Bishop Enrique Sánchez Martínez yavuze ko imiryango yagiye i Nuevo Laredo mu mpera za Mata, nubwo icyo gisagara nta cyo ari cyo cyiza ku bantu bagerageza kugerageza, mu rwego rwo kuba ari igice cy’igitero cy’i Northeast.

en: "It is new for us because this is the last place they come, due to the conditions of our border, of our city, which are sometimes adverse for migrants," the bishop said.
kin: Umwepiskopi yagize ati: "Ni shyashya kuri twe kuko aha niho hantu ha nyuma baza, bitewe n'imipaka yacu, umujyi wacu, rimwe na rimwe bikaba bibi ku bimukira."
mt0: "Ni igitangaza kubera ko ari igice cya nyuma cy'aho bagera, kubera imiterere y'inzira yacu, y'ibyo abaturage bagerageza, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibyo abaturage bagerageza guhura n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibibazo by'inzira yacu, n'ibi

en: "But since they opened the door in the United States to asylum requests, a lot of them came in large groups."
kin: "Ariko kuva bafungura umuryango muri Amerika gusaba ubuhunzi, benshi muri bo baza mu matsinda manini."
mt0: "Ariko kuva batanguye gufungura igikorwa cyo gufata ibihano mu Leta Zunze Ubumwe za Amerika, abantu benshi bageragezaga kugerageza gufata ibihano mu buryo bukomeye."

en: Marvin Ajic, the director of the Casa Nazareth shelter, said that around April 16, Mexican authorities notified the shelters that the United States would resume processing asylum claims for humanitarian reasons.
kin: Umuyobozi w'ikigo cya Casa Nazareth, Marvin Ajic, yavuze ko ahagana ku ya 16 Mata, abategetsi ba Mexico bamenyesheje ubwo buhungiro ko Amerika izakomeza gutunganya ibirego by'ubuhunzi kubera impamvu z’ubutabazi.
mt0: Marvin Ajic, umuyobozi wa Casa Nazareth shelter, yavuze ko ku wa 16 Mata, amakuru yashyizweho n’abashinzwe iperereza muri Meksiko yamenyesheje abashinzwe iperereza ko u Rwanda rwagiye rutangirira gukora imisoro y’abantu bafite ubuzima bubi.

en: The U.S. had begun allowing more people in, especially Central American adults, to prepare for lifting Title 42 — a pandemic-era health rule that denies migrants a chance to enter the U.S. seek asylum — on May 23. But a federal judge in Louisiana ruled last week that the government could not unwind the rule before the end date.
kin: Ku ya 23 Gicurasi, Amerika yari yatangiye kwemerera abantu benshi, cyane cyane abakuze bo muri Amerika yo Hagati, kwitegura gukuraho Umutwe wa 42 - itegeko ry’ubuzima bwo mu gihe cy’icyorezo kibuza abimukira amahirwe yo kwinjira muri Amerika gusaba ubuhungiro - ku ya 23 Gicurasi. Ariko umucamanza wa federasiyo muri Louisiana yemeje icyumweru gishize ko guverinoma idashobora gukuraho iryo tegeko mbere yitariki yo kurangiriraho.
mt0: U.S. yagiye ishyira abantu benshi mu Rwanda, cyane cyane abagore bo muri Amerika y’Epfo, kugira ngo ishyire imbaraga mu gushyingura Title 42 — igikorwa cy’ubuzima cy’igihe cyo gukuraho ibihano by’abashoferi n’abashaka gukora imibonano mpuzabitsina — ku wa 23 Mukakaro.

en: "The (Mexican) immigration officials organized things with the shelters, and the plan was to send people who had been waiting a long time, without any checks, basically anyone," Ajic said.
kin: Ajic yagize ati: "Abashinzwe abinjira n'abasohoka (Abanyamegizike) bateguye ibintu hamwe n'ubuhungiro, kandi gahunda yari iyo kohereza abantu bari bategereje igihe kirekire, nta sheki bafite, cyane cyane umuntu uwo ari we wese."
mt0: "Abantu bafite icyo bashaka bashyira mu bikorwa ibyo bavugaga ko ari imbere y'amategeko, n'abashyitsi bafite icyo bashaka, n'abantu bose, nta gushidikanya, nta gushidikanya," Ajic yavuze.

en: That apparently drew the attention of other migrants, including Haitians.
kin: Ikigaragara ni uko ibyo byashimishije abandi bimukira, harimo n'Abanyahayiti.
mt0: Ibyo rero ntibashoboye guhinduka gusa. Niba udashobora guhinduka uvuga uti uzi.

en: In September, similar rumors sparked a rush by about 15,000 mostly Haitian refugees to the Texas border, where they camped under a bridge. U.S. officials began large scale deportations of Haitians while also allowing thousands to remain in the U.S.
kin: Muri Nzeri, ibihuha nk'ibyo byatumye abantu bagera ku 15.000 bihutira cyane cyane impunzi zo muri Hayiti kugera ku mupaka wa Texas, aho bakambitse munsi y'ikiraro. Abayobozi ba Amerika batangiye kwirukana Abanyahayiti benshi mu gihe banemerera ibihumbi kuguma muri Amerika
mt0: In September, rumors nk’izo zatumye abantu bagera kuri 15,000, ahanini Abanyahaitian, batangura guhunga igihugu cy’Amerika, aho bakambiye inyuma y’umuhanda. U.S. officials began kubikisha abantu benshi inyuma y’amategeko y’Amerika, ariko abantu benshi batangura gusubira mu Rwanda.

en: Ajic warned migrants against coming to the border, noting the risks. On Monday, Mexico's National Immigration Institute said that so far this year, it has pulled the bodies of 19 immigrants from the Rio Grande, also known as the Rio Bravo.
kin: Ajic yihanangirije abimukira kwirinda kuza ku mupaka, avuga ingaruka. Ku wa mbere, Ikigo cy’igihugu gishinzwe abinjira n’abasohoka muri Mexico cyavuze ko kugeza uyu mwaka, kimaze gukuramo imirambo y’abimukira 19 bava muri Rio Grande, izwi kandi ku izina rya Rio Bravo.
mt0: Ajic yabwiye abagerageza kuja mu Rwanda ko batagomba kuja mu Rwanda, agaragaza ingaruka. Ku wa mbere, ibiro by’umuryango w’abanyamahanga bya Mexico byavuze ko mu mwaka ushize, byakuyeho imiburiburi imiburiburi imiburiburi 19 y’abagerageza kuja mu Rwanda.

en: New US Rule Grants Automatic Work Permit Extensions to Noncitizens

en: U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) announced Tuesday that it would automatically extend for 360 days the work permits of immigrants who applied to renew their work authorization amid the current backlog in processing times.

en: The new notice expands on the 180-day extension USCIS announced in November. It is expected to prevent about 260,000 immigrants from losing their work permits in the next 18 months. It will also give the agency extra time to clear applicants waiting in line, the agency said in a statement.
kin: Amatangazo mashya yagutse ku iyongerwa ry'iminsi 180 USCIS yatangaje mu Gushyingo. Biteganijwe ko bizabuza abimukira bagera ku 260.000 gutakaza uruhushya rwo gukora mu mezi 18 ari imbere. Bizatanga kandi ikigo cy’inyongera cyo gukuraho abasaba gutegereza umurongo, nkuko byatangajwe n’ikigo.
mt0: If you can't translate it simply say you don't know The new notice expands on the 180-day extension USCIS announced in November. It is expected to prevent about 260,000 immigrants from losing their work permits in the next 18 months. It will also give the agency extra time to clear applicants waiting in line, the agency said in a statement.

en: "This temporary rule will provide those noncitizens otherwise eligible for the automatic extension an opportunity to maintain employment and provide critical support for their families while avoiding further disruption for U.S. employers," USCIS Director Ur M. Jaddou said in a statement.
kin: Mu ijambo rye, Umuyobozi wa USCIS, Ur M. Jaddou, yagize ati: "Iri tegeko ry’agateganyo rizaha abo banyagihugu ubundi bemerewe kongererwa mu buryo bwikora amahirwe yo gukomeza akazi no gutanga inkunga ikomeye ku miryango yabo mu gihe birinda ko hajyaho ihungabana ku bakoresha ba Amerika."
