en: "Our rally in Marondera was purportedly banned and yet ZANU-PF was car rally and other unsanctioned in the very same area," she said. "Not once have they sought authorization or given notice to the police, yet these unlawful prohibitions are meted out against us. Ours is a struggle of non-violent resistance. However, the thousands that came out just to hear president Chamisa speak shows beyond any doubt that the citizens are prepared to do whatever it takes to reclaim their dignity. We continue to urge supporters to register to vote in their masses so that we attain our target in 2023: A landslide victory."
kin: Ati: "Imyigaragambyo yacu i Marondera byavuzwe ko yabujijwe nyamara ZANU-PF yari igiterane cy'imodoka ndetse n'ibindi bitemewe mu gace kamwe." "Ntabwo bigeze basaba uruhushya cyangwa ngo babimenyeshe abapolisi, nyamara ibyo bibujijwe mu buryo bunyuranyije n'amategeko byadushimishije. Iwacu ni urugamba rwo kurwanya ihohoterwa. Icyakora, ibihumbi n'ibihumbi byasohotse kugira ngo twumve perezida Chamisa avuga ibitaramo birenze ibyo ari byo byose. gushidikanya ko abaturage biteguye gukora ibishoboka byose kugira ngo bagarure icyubahiro cyabo. Turakomeza gusaba abayoboke kwiyandikisha kugira ngo batore mu mbaga yabo kugira ngo tugere ku ntego yacu mu 2023: Intsinzi idasanzwe. "

en: Zimbabwe police Sunday refused to comment on the ban of the Citizens Coalition for Change in Marondera. It issued a letter to the opposition saying it needed time to prepare to ensure there was peace at the rally. Two weeks ago, violence instigated by suspected ruling ZANU-PF supporters at a Citizens Coalition for Change rally resulted in two deaths and dozens injured.
kin: Ku cyumweru abapolisi ba Zimbabwe banze kugira icyo batangaza ku ihagarikwa ry’abenegihugu baharanira impinduka muri Marondera. Yasohoye ibaruwa abatavuga rumwe n’ubutegetsi ivuga ko hakenewe igihe cyo kwitegura kugira ngo imyigaragambyo ibe amahoro. Ibyumweru bibiri bishize, urugomo rwatewe n’abakekwaho kuba bashyigikiye ZANU-PF mu myigaragambyo y’abaturage iharanira impinduka zahitanye abantu babiri abandi benshi barakomereka.
mt0: Zimbabwe police refuse to comment on the ban of the Citizens Coalition for Change in Marondera. It issued a letter to the opposition saying it needed time to prepare to ensure there was peace at the rally. Two weeks ago, violence instigated by suspected ruling ZANU-PF supporters at a Citizens Coalition for Change rally resulted in two deaths and dozens injured.

en: Alexander Rusero, a former senior politics lecturer at Harare Polytechnic college, says police and political parties must thwart violence at opposition rallies.
kin: Alexander Rusero wahoze ari umwarimu mukuru muri politiki muri kaminuza ya Harare Polytechnic, avuga ko abapolisi n’imitwe ya politiki bagomba gukumira ihohoterwa mu myigaragambyo itavuga rumwe n’ubutegetsi.
mt0: Alexander Rusero, a former senior politics lecturer at Harare Polytechnic college, says police and political parties must thwart violence at opposition rallies.

en: Police have arrested 16 suspected ZANU-PF supporters who are accused of causing the violence and who now face murder charges in connection with the deaths at the opposition rally.
kin: Polisi yataye muri yombi abantu 16 bakekwaho kuba bashyigikiye ZANU-PF baregwa kuba barateje urugomo none bakaba bakurikiranyweho ubwicanyi bakekwaho kuba barapfiriye mu myigaragambyo y'abatavuga rumwe n’ubutegetsi.
mt0: Police yafashe 16 ba suspected ZANU-PF supporters bafite icyo bavuga ko ari bo bafite uruhare mu rupfasoni ndetse n'ubu bakurikiranwa n'ubufatanye n'urupfasoni n'urupfasoni rwabaye mu ijoro ry'opposition.

en: A Zimbabwe Court Dismisses Suspension of Striking Teachers
kin: Urukiko rwa Zimbabwe rwanze ihagarikwa ry’abarimu bigaragambyaga
mt0: A Zimbabwe Court Dismisses the Suspension of Striking Teachers.

en: Zimbabwe's High Court has voided the government's three-month suspension of striking teachers, ruling the ministry of education overstepped its authority. The teachers went on strike last week over poor salaries just as schools were set to reopen after a long break due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Analysts say children's education has been caught in the crossfire.
kin: Urukiko rukuru rwa Zimbabwe rwanze ko guverinoma ihagarika amezi atatu ihagarika abarimu bigaragambyaga, ivuga ko minisiteri y’uburezi yarenze ububasha bwayo. Mu cyumweru gishize abarimu bagiye mu myigaragambyo kubera umushahara muke nkuko amashuri yari yiteguye gufungura nyuma yikiruhuko kirekire kubera icyorezo cya COVID-19. Abasesenguzi bavuga ko uburezi bw'abana bwafatiwe mu muriro.
mt0: If you can't translate the sentence simply say you don't know

en: Zimbabwes High Court has ruled the suspension of striking teachers by Evelyn Ndlovu, Zimbabwes minister of primary and secondary education, was illegal.
kin: Urukiko rukuru rwa Zimbabwes rwemeje ko ihagarikwa ry’abarimu bigaragambyaga na Evelyn Ndlovu, minisitiri w’ishuri ryibanze n’ayisumbuye rya Zimbabwes, bitemewe.
mt0: Zimbabwe's High Court has ruled that the suspension of striking teachers by Evelyn Ndlovu, Zimbabwe's minister of primary and secondary education, was illegal.

en: Noble Chinhanu of the Zimbabwe Human Rights NGO Forum represented the teachers in court.
kin: Noble Chinhanu wo mu ihuriro ry’imiryango itegamiye kuri Leta iharanira uburenganzira bwa muntu muri Zimbabwe yari ahagarariye abarimu mu rukiko.
mt0: Noble Chinhanu of the Zimbabwe Human Rights NGO Forum represented the teachers in court.

en: "We managed to present our arguments before the court and the judge has given us an order to the effect that the press statement that was issued by the minister of primary and secondary education is illegal and unconstitutional," said Chinhanu. "We managed to prove that our client has a right not to be suspended in such a manner which was in violation of public service regulations of the nation."
kin: Chinhanu yagize ati: "Twashoboye gutanga ibitekerezo byacu imbere y'urukiko kandi umucamanza yaduhaye itegeko kugira ngo itangazo ry'abanyamakuru ryatanzwe na minisitiri w'amashuri abanza n'ayisumbuye bitemewe kandi binyuranyije n'Itegeko Nshinga." "Twashoboye kwerekana ko umukiriya wacu afite uburenganzira bwo kudahagarikwa mu buryo bunyuranyije n'amategeko agenga abakozi ba Leta."

en: Schools in Zimbabwe closed last year during the COVID-19 pandemic and had been due to reopen last week.
kin: Amashuri yo muri Zimbabwe yarafunzwe umwaka ushize mugihe cyanduye COVID-19 kandi yagombaga gufungura icyumweru gishize.

en: Gibson Nyikadzino, an independent political analyst, says the government and teachers must settle the strike quickly because students continue to be the losers.
kin: Gibson Nyikadzino, umusesenguzi wa politiki wigenga, avuga ko guverinoma n'abarimu bagomba gukemura vuba imyigaragambyo kuko abanyeshuri bakomeje gutsindwa.
mt0: Gibson Nyikadzino, umunyapolitiki ufite ubutwari, says the government and teachers must settle the strike quickly because students continue to be the losers.

en: "We are seeing a lot of agitation and politicization of this from the employees," said Nyikadzino. "They are not keen to listen to what the employer is saying. Their parties that are being affected as a result of this, so what has to be done is go to the tripartite negotiating forum and in the spirit find a consensus."
kin: Nyikadzino ati: "Turimo kubona imyigaragambyo myinshi na politiki mu bakozi." "Ntabwo bashishikajwe no kumva ibyo umukoresha avuga. Amashyaka yabo agira ingaruka kuri ibyo, bityo rero ikigomba gukorwa ni ukujya mu ihuriro ry’ibiganiro bitatu kandi mu mwuka ugashaka ubwumvikane."
mt0: "Ntabwo ari igitekerezo cy'ibyo abantu bavuga, ariko abantu ntibashobora kumva ibyo umuntu uvuga. en: Sifiso Ndlovu from the Zimbabwe Teachers Association – the countrys largest teachers union – says educators want to return to work, but need more pay to sustain themselves.
kin: Sifiso Ndlovu wo mu ishyirahamwe ry'abarimu bo muri Zimbabwe - ibihugu by’abarimu benshi mu bihugu - avuga ko abarezi bifuza gusubira ku kazi, ariko bakeneye umushahara mwinshi kugira ngo batunge.
mt0: If you can't translate simply say you don't know. Sifiso Ndlovu from the Zimbabwe Teachers Association – the country's largest teachers union – says educators want to return to work, but need more pay to sustain themselves.

en: "There are some members who are unable to travel: those who are far distant schools. They are finding it difficult because of the resources," said Ndlovu. "And there are some who are saying while we are within the school environs, we still find it difficult to find food for subsistence. That is what is mitigating against 100 percent attendance. We hope that after pay day (next week Tuesday) things will get back to normal. But that does not mean that the teachers are happy with the remuneration that they are getting. They still want some more."
kin: Ndlovu ati: "Hariho abanyamuryango bamwe badashobora gutembera: abari kure cyane y'amashuri. Basanga bigoye kubera amikoro." "Kandi hari bamwe bavuga mu gihe turi mu nkengero z'ishuri, turacyabona ko bigoye kubona ibiryo byo gutunga. Nicyo kigabanya kugabanya kwitabira 100%. Turizera ko nyuma yo kwishyura (icyumweru gitaha ku wa kabiri) ibintu bizagenda subira mu buzima busanzwe. Ariko ibyo ntibisobanura ko abarimu bishimiye umushahara bahabwa. Baracyashaka ibindi. "

en: Taungana Ndoro, is the spokesman for Zimbabwes ministry of primary and secondary education and says the situation in schools now is "encouraging."

en: The pay dispute goes back to October 2018, when the government stopped paying civil servants in U.S. dollars, switching to the reintroduced Zimbabwean dollar. The new currency has steadily lost value, effectively reducing teacher wages to about $100 a month. The teachers want the $540 a month they were getting in 2018.
kin: Impaka z’imishahara zisubira mu Kwakira 2018, igihe guverinoma yahagaritse kwishyura abakozi ba Leta mu madorari y’Amerika, ihindura amadorari ya Zimbabwe. Ifaranga rishya ryatakaje agaciro, kugabanya umushahara wa mwarimu kugera ku madolari 100 ku kwezi. Abarimu bifuza amadorari 540 ku kwezi babonaga muri 2018.
mt0: Iyi nkunga ihera mu October 2018, igihe igihugu cyatangiye guha akazi abakozi mu dollars z’Amerika, bihuriye n’u Zimbabwean dollar. Iyi nkunga igiye gusimbura u Rwanda, igihugu cy’Ubushinwa n’Ubushinwa.

en: Last week the teachers rejected the governments offer of a 20 percent pay raise along with some incentives, such as housing loans.

mt0: Last week the teachers rejected the government's offer of a 20% pay raise along with some incentives, such as housing loans.

en: Zimbabwe Government Orders Vaccinated Workers Back to Work
kin: Guverinoma ya Zimbabwe yategetse abakozi bakingiwe gusubira ku kazi
mt0: Zimbabwe Government Orders Vaccinated Workers Back to Work

en: Zimbabwes government has ordered civil servants who are vaccinated against COVID-19 to immediately report for duty after more than a year of working from home, citing a declining in new cases of the virus in the country.
kin: Guverinoma ya Zimbabwe yategetse abakozi ba Leta bakingiwe COVID-19 guhita batanga raporo ku kazi nyuma y’umwaka urenga bakorera mu rugo, bavuga ko umubare w’abanduye virusi ugabanuka.
mt0: Zimbabwe y’ubutegetsi yategekanyije abakozi bafite urukingo rwa COVID-19 kugerageza gukora akazi nyuma y’imyaka igera kuri ibiri bakorera ahantu hashya, n’aho inyuma y’uko abantu benshi bagaragaye ko ari bo bafite icyo virusi.

en: Authorities also announced any government workers without proof of vaccination will be barred from workplaces and face punishments, including a freeze on their salaries.
kin: Abayobozi batangaje kandi ko abakozi ba leta badafite gihamya y’inkingo bazabuzwa gukorerwa kandi bagahanwa, harimo no guhagarika umushahara.

en: In a statement this week, President Emmerson Mnangagwas government said it wants its employees to resume meeting in person. Late Tuesday, Monica Mutsvangwa, the countrys information minister, said the number of people being hospitalized for COVID-19 is on a steady decline.
kin: Mu ijambo rye kuri iki cyumweru, guverinoma ya Perezida Emmerson Mnangagwas yavuze ko ishaka ko abakozi bayo bakomeza inama ku giti cyabo. Ku wa kabiri, Minica Mutsvangwa, minisitiri w’itangazamakuru mu gihugu, yavuze ko umubare w’abantu bari mu bitaro bya COVID-19 ugenda ugabanuka.
mt0: In a statement this week, President Emmerson Mnangagwa's government said it wants its employees to resume meeting in person. Late Tuesday, Monica Mutsvangwa, the country's information minister, said the number of people being hospitalized for COVID-19 is on a steady decline.

en: "This indicates that the national response measures instituted by government continue to pay off. …In view of the continued decline in new cases and deaths, coupled with a declining testing positivity rate that is indicating that the community transmission has gone down, all ports of entry [are to] be reopened, but ensuring that all the recommended COVID-19 prevention measures are adhered to," she said.

en: Many Zimbabwean schools that closed because of the COVID-19 pandemic remain shuttered as teachers refuse to return to the classroom, citing a need for better pay.

en: The teachers are paid less than $100 a month. The government has offered a 20 percent pay increase and other incentives, but the teachers have rejected that offer as insufficient.
kin: Abarimu bahembwa amafaranga atarenga 100 ku kwezi. Guverinoma yatanze umushahara wiyongereyeho 20 ku ijana n'agahimbazamusyi, ariko abarimu babyanze bavuga ko ibyo bidahagije.

en: Meanwhile, some youths are studying independently. One such student, a 16-year-old, said, "My appeal [to the government] is for a salary increment for teachers so that they come to work, because we arent learning. Its like we are paying fees for nothing. Its so painful as my parents are struggling for it when I am not learning at all."

en: "We asked for the restoration of salaries, which were robbed from us by the government of the day," Masaraure said. "And the message to the government is clear: We need our pre-October 2018 salaries of 540 dollars U.S. We know these shenanigans of adding an extra dollar to our salaries — that does not add up."
kin: Masaraure ati: "Twasabye guverinoma iriho kuvugurura imishahara tugahabwa umushahara wari uriho mbere Kandi ubutumwa kuri guverinoma burasobanutse: Dukeneye imishahara ibanziriza Ukwakira 2018 y'amadorari 540 y'Abanyamerika. Turabizi iyi gahunda  yo kongera amadorari  ku mushahara - ibyo ntacyo bifasha."
mt0: "Twatanze icyemezo ko ubutunzi bwacu bwacuburijwe, n'ubutegetsi bw'icyo gihe," Masaraure yavuze. "Ntabwo ari igitekerezo cyiza, ariko icyo cyemezo ni icyumvikana: Tugomba gukora n'ibyo twari twahawe mu October 2018. Turazi izo nshingano z'uko ubutunzi bwacu bugomba gukora n'ibyo twari twahawe mu October 2018.

en: Government officials see the ongoing talks in a different light and voice optimism about a successful resolution.

mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura icyo uvuga, uvuga ko ufite ibyiringiro byinshi byo kugira ngo umuntu ashobore gukora icyo ashaka.

en: Paul Mavima, Zimbabwe's minister of public service, labor and social welfare, said, "In many ways we already have a breakthrough. The leaders of the workers have to a very large extent welcomed this package and they are only saying: Lets discuss how it is going to be implemented."
kin: Minisitiri w’imirimo ifitiye igihugu akamaro, umurimo n’imibereho myiza y’abaturage muri Zimbabwe, Paul Mavima, yagize ati:  Tumaze gutera intambwe mu nzira zitandukanye zo gukemura ibibazo. Abakoresha bagomba kwishimira cyane iyi gahunda bagafata umwanya wo kuganira ku buryo igiye gushyirwa mu bikorwa. "
mt0: Paul Mavima, Zimbabwe's minister of public service, labor and social welfare, said, "In many ways we already have a breakthrough. The leaders of the workers have to a very large extent welcomed this package and they are only saying: Lets discuss how it is going to be implemented."

en: The teachers and government are expected to meet in coming days to resume negotiations. Meanwhile, students wait to resume their studies months after the COVID-19 pandemic forced their schools to close.
kin: Biteganijwe ko abarimu na guverinoma bazahura mu minsi iri imbere kugira ngo bakomeze ibiganiro. Hagati aho, abanyeshuri bategereje gukomeza amasomo yabo nyuma y'amezi ashize batiga kubera icyorezo cya COVID-19 cyatumye amashuri afunga.
mt0: Icyo gihe, abigishwa n’ubutegetsi bizahura mu ndwi izakurikira kugira ngo batangire imigenderanire. Abanyeshure ntibashobora gusubira mu mashuri nyuma y’amezi abiri y’uko amakuru y’uko icyorezo cya COVID-19 cyatumye ibigo byabo byafunga.

en: Private Military Contractors Bolster Russian Influence in Africa

en: But around Africa, the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) in Washington has found evidence since 2016 of Russian soldiers of fortune in Sudan, South Sudan, Libya, the Central African Republic (CAR), Madagascar and Mozambique.

en: In Africa "there is a convergence of many states' interests, including China's," Alexey Mukhin of the Moscow-based Centre for Political Information told AFP.

en: "Every state has the right to defend its business assets," he added.

en: When the EU wanted to sanction the group in 2020, it targeted Russian oligarch Yevgeny Prigozhin, an ally of President Vladimir Putin who is suspected of running Wagner.

mt0: When the EU wanted to sanction the group in 2020, it targeted Russian oligarch Yevgeny Prigozhin, an ally of President Vladimir Putin who is suspected of running Wagner.

en: Western experts say military contractors are embedded in Russia's official forces like intelligence agencies and the army, providing plausible deniability for Moscow.
kin: Impuguke z’iburengerazuba zivuga ko ingabo za gisirikare zinjiye mu butegetsi bw’Uburusiya nk’inzego z’ubutasi n’ingabo, ibyo ariko Moscou ikabihakana.

en: Their deployment to African countries aims to "enable Russia to... regain this sphere of influence" that fell away with the collapse of the Soviet Union, said CSIS researcher Catrina Doxsee.
kin: Koherezwa kwabo mu bihugu bya Afurika bigamije "gutuma Uburusiya buzahuka... kugira ngo buzahure ubukungu  bwagizweho ingaruka no gusenyuka kw'Abasoviyeti, nk'uko byatangajwe n'umushakashatsi wa CSIS, Catrina Doxsee.

en: The mercenaries' presence has been growing even faster since a 2019 Russia-Africa summit.

en: Moscow has been active "especially in what has traditionally been France's zone of influence" in former colonies like CAR and Mali, said Djallil Lounnas, a researcher at Morocco's Al Akhawayn university.
kin: Djallil Lounnas, umushakashatsi muri kaminuza ya Al Akhawayn ya Maroc, yatangaje ko Moscou yagize uruhare "cyane cyane mu byahoze ari akarere k’Ubufaransa".
mt0: Moscow yagiye ikora "cyane cyane mu duce twa kera byagiye ari igice cy’ubukoloni bwa France" mu ntara nka CAR na Mali, nk’uko Djallil Lounnas, umushakashatsi muri kaminuza ya Morocco y’Abakawayn yavuze.

en: While military contractors sometimes shepherd Russian arms sales, the revenue "really pales compared with the profit they are able to generate from mining concessions and access to natural resources," Doxsee said.
kin: Doxsee yagize ati: "Nubwo abashoramari rimwe na rimwe bagerageza kugurisha ibirwanisho by’Uburusiya, amafaranga binjiza ni make  rwose ugereranije n’inyungu bashobora kubona mu bucukuzi bw’amabuye y'agaciro no kubona umutungo kamere ".
mt0: While military contractors sometimes shepherd Russian arms sales, the revenue "really pales compared with the profit they are able to generate from mining concessions and access to natural resources," Doxsee said.

en: That makes unstable countries with mineral or hydrocarbon wealth prime customers — such as in Syria where the mercenaries first became known to the wider public.

kin: Muri CAR, Umuryango w’abibumbye urimo gukora iperereza ku bwicanyi bwabaye hagati y'ingabo za leta n’abarwanyi ba Wagner.
mt0: In the CAR, the United Nations is probing an alleged massacre during a joint operation by government forces and Wagner fighters.

en: One military source told AFP that more than 50 people died, some in "summary executions."
kin: Hari igitabo kimwe cya gisirikare cyatangarije AFP ko abantu barenga 50 bapfuye, mucyo bise "kwicwa muri make."
mt0: Icyo gitero cy'abategetsi cyavuze ko abantu bagera kuri 50 bapfuye, bamwe mu bo bavugaga ko ari "ibikorwa byo gupfa bifatiye ku buryo busanzwe."

en: On Thursday, the European Union said it would not resume military training in the CAR — suspended since mid-December — unless the country's soldiers stop working for Wagner.
kin: Ku wa kane, Umuryango w’ubumwe bw’ibihugu by’Uburayi wavuze ko utazongera imyitozo ya gisirikare muri CAR - yahagaritswe kuva hagati mu Kuboza - keretse igihe  abasirikare b’iki gihugu bazaba bahagaritse gukorera Wagner.
mt0: Iyo udashobora gukora icyo ushaka, vuga ntiugomba gukora icyo ushaka ukundi. Ku wa Kabiri, u Rwanda n'Ubushinwa ntibyagiye batanga imibonano mpuzamakungu y'abategetsi mu Rwanda - inyuma y'uko imibonano mpuzamakungu yatangujwe mu kwezi kwa cumi n'umwe - ntabwo umuntu ashoboye gukora icyo ushaka ukundi.

en: Meanwhile the mercenaries' results do not always measure up to the hopes of the governments that hire them.
kin: Hagati aho ariko, ibikorwa by'abacanshuro ntabwo buri gihe bisibiza ibyifuzo bya guverinoma iba yabahaye akazi.
mt0: Iyo udashobora guhindura igitekerezo gusa. Niba udashobora guhindura igitekerezo gusa uvuga uti uzi.

en: In Libya, Russian mercenaries suffered heavy losses in Marshal Khalifa Haftar's year-long attempt to conquer the capital Tripoli, which was ultimately unsuccessful.
kin: Muri Libiya, abacanshuro b'Abarusiya bagize igihombo kinini muri Marshal Khalifa Haftar umwaka wose kukon bagerageje kwigarurira umurwa mukuru Tripoli, ariko ntibyashoboka.
mt0: In Libya, abashoferi ba rusiyani bafite ingufu zikomeye mu ntumbero y'imyaka ibiri ya Marshal Khalifa Haftar yo kugarura Tripoli, ariko icyo cyemezo cy'uko cyigeze cyibura.

en: And in Mozambique, the Russians retreated in the face of Islamic State group jihadists, ultimately losing out to South African competitors.
kin: Kandi muri Mozambike, Abarusiya igihe bari bateganye n' abajihadiste bo mu mutwe wa kisilamu basubira inyuma, nyuma baza nabo gutsindwa n’abarwanyi ba Afurika yepfo.
mt0: In Mozambique, the Russians retreated in the face of Islamic State group jihadists, ultimately losing out to South African competitors.

en: Although lacking language skills and experience with the terrain, Wagner "were picked because they were the cheapest", Doxsee said.
kin: Doxsee yavuze ko nubwo badafite ubumenyi bw’ururimi n'uburambe kuri ubu butaka, Wagner "batoranijwe kubera ko ari bo bahendutse".
mt0: Abantu bafite ubumenyi bwo kuvuga n'ubumenyi bwo kumenya imiterere y'ibinyabuzima, Wagner "batoranyijwe kubera ko bari bafite uburyo bworoshye bwo gufata icyemezo", Doxsee yavuze.

en: "They didn't have what it took to succeed," she added, noting that "they've had a fair few failures" across Africa.
kin: Yongeyeho ati: "Ntabwo bari bafite icyo basabwa kugira ngo batsinde." Yongeyeho ko "batsinzwe bitari bike" muri Afurika.
mt0: "Ntabwo bafite ibyo byose byabaye ngo bagume bagera ku ntumbero," yagize ati, nubwo "bafite amakuru make y'uko nta n'imwe y'ibibazo byabaye" mu Rwanda.

en: Succeeding completely might actually harm the mercenaries' business model, which thrives on unrest, conflict and crisis.
kin: Intsinzi irashobora rwose kwangiza ibikorwa byubucuruzi bwabacanshuro, bitera imbere mumidugararo, amakimbirane nibibazo.
mt0: Iyo umuntu agaragaje ko ashoboye gukora neza ashobora gukomeza gukora nabi uburyo bwo gukora akazi bw’aba mercenaries, bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi bwo gukora akazi

en: "If a country such as the CAR hires them to train forces, to help them in their military efforts, its in their interest to accomplish that just well enough to continue to be employed," Doxsee said.
kin: Doxsee ati: "Niba igihugu nka CAR kibahaye akazi ko gutoza ingabo, no kubafasha mu bikorwa byabo bya gisirikare, ni ngombwa kubahiriza izo nshingano kugira ngo bakomeze guhabwa akazi".
mt0: "Niba igihugu nka CAR gifata nk'uko aricyo cyohereje abantu kugira ngo bafashe ingufu, ngo bafashe ingufu mu bikorwa byabo bya military, nibyo by'ukuri byagiye bikorwa neza n'uko ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari byo byo ari

en: "If they actually were to do it well enough to resolve the conflict, they would no longer be needed."
kin: Baramutse babikoze neza bagakemura amakimbirane, ntibakongera gukenerwa
mt0: "Niba bishoboka ko bashoboraga gukora neza ndetse bagakemura icyo kibazo, ntibagikenewe."
